characters: MEDIUM TWO-SHOT ON FRANK AND LANA
A PAIR OF SEXY HIGH HEELS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sultry dampness of a blistering summer hangs in the n air. People stroll the boardwalk looking for a cool breez The soft rhythms of a jazz concert float from the band sh

dialogues.speaker: A PAIR OF SEXY HIGH HEELS
dialogues.text: and a woman's shapely legs, walking along the wooden pier OPENING TITLES & CREDITS OVER. After several steps, a discarded piece of gum sticks to o of her shoes, stretching out stickily. Two steps later, a piece of paper sticks to the gum, flopping awkwardly with each step. The MOVING CAMERA PANS UP her gorgeous legs and sensuous  body. She wears a loose summer dress that floats like gos around her soft curves. Her hair is long and blond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To some guys, women are like a cheap  puzzle... with pieces that just don't  fit. They think the soul of a woman  is darker than a back alley... more  tangled than a telephone cord... and  colder than a Klondike Bar in Canada.  But those guys don't even have a  clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops at the railing. We see an incredibly beautiful  face and cool, alluring eyes. This is LOLA CAIN. The term "femme fatale" was coined for her. She's on display... an knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you know women the way I do,  you understand exactly what what  makes them tick... what makes them  hum... what makes them jiggle up and  down when they walk. And it's not  the kind of thing you can learn from  a correspondence course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA MOVES with her as she walks on, passing TWO ME whose eyes are glued to her. We HOLD ON THEM. One is NED RAVINE, in his thirties, stalwart, handsome, h trimmed neatly, but with a feel of loose ends about him.. coat slung over his shoulder, sleeves rolled up, the swea dampening his shirt. He's a cop. A plain clothes detectiv who's been around the block a few times and still gets lo Next to him is ARCH, his partner. Older, if not in years, least in mileage. Dependable, solid, with no great aspira except to reach the end of a shift intact. He's eating Na from a cardboard container, licking the cheese off his  fingers. The CAMERA PUSHES IN to NED. His eyes are fixed on Lola.

dialogues.speaker: LOLA
dialogues.text: She walks to the other side of the pier... as more paper  sticks to the gum on her shoe. She stands at the railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two kinds of women in this  world... and I've known 'em both.

dialogues.speaker: ARCH
dialogues.text: Arch heaves an exasperated sigh and looks toward Ned. The CAMERA PULLS BACK to INCLUDE NED. It isn't "voice-over"  narration at all. Ned is actually talking out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One will take you for a fast ride on  a bumpy road with no seat belt. But  the other kind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) Jeez... knock off the chatter, will  ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to keep you awake, Arch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm awake! Where do you come up with  all that crap about women?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. Women are very complex,  but if you know how to read 'em...  they're an open book. You can always  tell the rotten apples from the  peaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kiddin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd stake my career on it. Anybody  ever proves me wrong, I'll throw  away my badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aayyhh... women are trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to believe that too. Until I  married Lana. Now, she... is a peach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you're a lucky stiff,  pal. Ya hold down two jobs. Got a  beautiful wife waitin' for ya at  home. Everything a guy could ever  want, including NO kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to have kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Rug-rats? Give me a break! (looks around) Jeez, I hate stakeouts. What makes  you think Milo's gonna show up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logic. He knocked off all those banks.  He's got cash. He's gonna want to  spend it. This is one of the few  places that still takes cash. Sooner  or later... he's gotta turn up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how we s'posed to recognize this  scumbag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Support Hose Bandit"? When you  see him... you'll know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., MILO CRUMLEY, the "Support Hose Bandit", amb by casually, unnoticed, sucking on a cherry Snow-Cone thr the panty-hose pulled down over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the best damn Nachos in  North America. Maybe the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops the last chip in his mouth, licks his fingers and turns the container over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm empty. I'm gonna get a refill.  You want some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned shakes his head. Arch heads off to the Nacho stand. N steps over to the railing... gazes out at the ocean. A SAXOPHONE begins to wail a scorching, romantic melody.. recurrent tune that will come to be known as LOLA'S THEME A beat later... Lola moves to Ned's side at the railing. tries to ignore her presence, peering into the darkness.  Lola digs in her purse for a pack of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned pulls out a small flashlight, shines it in her purse. She pulls a cigarette out of the pack, puts it to her lip her eyes on Ned, sizing him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a match?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. I have plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out a handful of matchbooks, shows her, then stu them back in his pocket. He turns and walks along the pier. She falls into step be him, lighting her own cigarette. A saxophone player named DIZZY follows behind them, continuing to play. He's the a source of the romantic THEME MUSIC we've been hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really are incredibly stupid,  aren't you? I like that in a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be insulted, but I know you're  serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound so sure of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not as dumb as I look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me buy you a drink, Mr. uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravine. Ned Ravine. And you are...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirsty. What about that drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brain surgeon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooo... and I bet you have a big  gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola looks toward a nearby hot dog vendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can't buy you a drink... (nods toward vendor) ...let me buy you one of those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who can say no to a weiner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola turns to the hot dog VENDOR, raising two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dogs. Hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes them... hands one to Ned. He picks up the plast mustard container to put mustard on her hot dog first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come here often?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when I'm in heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned REACTS to this, squeezing the container. A stream of  mustard squirts out, hitting the front of Lola's dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flustered, he stuffs his hot dog into his inside jacket  pocket, then tries to wipe the mustard off Lola's dress,  smearing it all over her, making it worse. She watches hi with a cool, detached gaze as he fumbles ingenuously. Suddenly, Ned stops, looking off. He sees... Milo Crumley going into the PUBLIC RESTROOM. Ned starts to leave. Lola grabs his hand, holding it tightly against her breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where ya going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get something to wipe it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. You're doing just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you a wet paper towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the men's room... signaling to Arch, who's  waiting in line at the Nacho stand. Arch motions at the l line... all UNIFORMED COPS... shrugging helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several MEN are at the urinals. Milo, still wearing the p hose over his head, washes his face at the sink. He looks up, sees Ned enter. Ned sees Milo... reacts, pulling the  frankfurter out of his pocket and pointing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it right there, Milo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Men turn, seeing Ned pointing the frankfurter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! He's got a weenie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo bolts, slamming into Ned, knocking him back through door of a stall, into the lap of the MAN inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo bursts out, colliding with Arch. They both go down i flurry of Nacho chips and cheese. Arch helps Milo to his  feet, apologizing profusely... picking up the gun that Mi dropped, handing it back to him. Milo sprints off down th pier. A beat later, Ned bursts out the door... dashing after Mi

dialogues.speaker: ALONG THE PIER
dialogues.text: Milo runs frantically, knocking people aside! He ducks in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and drags a FLUSTERED MAN out of a bumper car, jumps i and speeds away! A beat later, Ned runs up, followed by Arch. Ned flashes badge at a FRECKLE-FACED KID in one of the bumper cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police emergency! I need your car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the kid out, jumps in, slaps a portable FLASHING RED LIGHT on the dashboard... then speeds off after Milo, SIREN WAILING! He zig-zags through the crush of other bum cars in the pavilion. Ned's bumper car catches up with Milo, pulling alongside. Milo turns the wheel, RAMMING Ned! Ned RAMS him back, bot bumper cars swerving violently... spraying SPARKS! Ned SLAMS Milo's car again! Milo loses control, spins out and SMASHES into the pavillion railing! Ned swerves to avoid a collision, but RAMS into two other bumper cars, wrenching to a grinding halt. A BEAT. The AI inflates in his bumper car. Arch runs up as Ned pulls himself from the wreckage. They turn to see Milo leap from his mangled bumper car, leap o the pavillion railing and dash down the pier and into an  alley between two buildings. A sign on the building says: DEAD END ALLEY. Ned and Arch eye each other, shake their heads, and follo after Milo.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: Milo runs into a tall chain link fence at the end of the  alley and scrambles up the wire mesh. Suddenly, Ned's han shoots out, grabs Milo's ankle, yanking him down hard. Milo jumps to his feet, swinging at Ned, who catches Milo fist with his hand, stopping it cold... neatly snapping a handcuff on his wrist. He shoves Milo's arm against the f and snaps the other cuff to the chainlink. A SWITCHBLADE flashes out of Milo's other hand with a sha CLICK! Milo slashes the blade at Ned, just missing his fa On the backswing, Ned parries with his own switchblade an flips Milo's knife away. Milo pulls a .45 Calibre REVOLVER with his free hand! Ned shoves his finger into the end of the barrel. Milo looks  surprised... then sneers, clicking the hammer back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take science in high school,  Milo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I skipped high school, cop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're probably not familiar  with the theory of inverse  proportionate explosive dynamics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you fire a weapon with the barrel  obstructed, the explosive force  multiplies by twenty-three point  five nine eight and reverses on itself  with diametric polarity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun will blow up in your hand...  and it won't even scorch my pinkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! That's just theoretical  hypothesis. Inverse proportionate  explosive dynamics has never been  demonstrated conclusively in a  laboratory environment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Then pull the trigger, smart  guy. Let's find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo hesitates, unsure. Finally, he releases the gun. Ned raises it up on the end of his finger. Arch pulls it off  with a loud POP! Ned cuffs Milo's hands behind him... spins him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent...  next... if you waive that right,  anything you say... next...

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL ARCH
dialogues.text: holding up a series of "cue cards"... as Ned reads from t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...may be used against you in a court  of law... next... You have the right  to an attorney... Do you have an  attorney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nahhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then today's your lucky day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips out a business card, handing it to Milo.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUSINESS CARD
dialogues.text: It reads... "Ned Ravine - Defense Attorney"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large. Expensive. Impressive. The name on the mailbox rea "Ned and Lana Ravine." We begin to HEAR the O.S. SOUND of passionate lovemaking!

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA MOVES up the stairs, into the bedroom. Still O we hear more heavy breathing... urgent whispers... lust.. passion... squeaky bedsprings! A trail of clothes is scattered before us on the way to t bed... shoes, a dress, slip, bra, nylons, panties... grea coveralls with a "Frank Kelbo - Mobile Mechanic" namepatc dirty work boots, a wrench and a gigantic grease gun... The bed shakes violently. A female VOICE calls the shots various tools drop to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, Frank! Adjust the stroke by  ten percent! That's it. (CLUNK! A wrench) Now tweak my points. Oh yes, oh yes! (THUNK! Pliers) You got it! Stabilize your ball joints  and grind my rear differential! (CLINK! Screwdriver) Now accelerate! Floor it! Lay rubber,  baby! VRRROOOOOOOOOOMMMMMMMMM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. The LIGHT clicks ON. LANA; a sexy redhead with a  cool, manipulative edge, and FRANK; a slick, smarmy Lotha lay under the sheets, panting, glistening with sweat. Lana reaches for a pack of "Fatal 100's" on the bedside t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad for an auto mechanic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins, cocky) Yeah, well you're not so bad  yourself... for a lawyer's wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better watch your tongue, sweetie,  or I'll have my husband arrest you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy man. Cop and a lawyer. When  does he ever find time for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lights a cigarette... exhales a soft, gloomy cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't. That's why I need you to  keep my engine tuned, Frank. Why  drive a jalopy when you can have a  hot rod?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should trade him in on a  new model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would... if I could make any money  on the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaches for her) Want to go for another test drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of an automobile engine outside. Lana stops him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over and park it, Frank. I'm  still under warranty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned glances at the white van parked in the driveway, then takes note of his wife's silver Mercedes... sitting on fl jacks, the hood raised, tools spread out around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned enters. Lana wears a diaphanous dressing gown, button unevenly, hair disheveled. She smokes a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned kisses her on the back of the neck as he passes throu the kitchen on his way to the dining room. She reacts wit bored, contemptuous disinterest, picking up the coffee po

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Want some coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned steps back into the kitchen with his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned sees Frank sitting at the kitchen table, hair messed coveralls hastily pulled on inside-out. Frank is reading copy of INSURANCE DIGEST magazine. A headline on the cove touts an article: "LIFE INSURANCE FOR YOUR CAT!... Cover Nine Lives For The Price of One!" Ned's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank here was just grabbing a little  before going back to work on my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps over to the table... gives Frank a cool stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been working on Lana's  Mercedes, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Oh... I don't know... six, seven  weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ya still haven't found the  problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a leering smile) Think I got my finger on it though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned turns to Lana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what he's doing, Lana. I wasn't  born yesterday. He's not fixing your  car. He's SCREWING you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana tenses up at this. Frank freezes. He figures they've been busted. He sits there, holding the magazine, not mov a muscle... as Ned turns on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU are screwing my wife! I can see  what your game is, Frank. You open  up her hood, poke around in there...  squirt some lubrication in... play  around with all her parts... then  take an old used piston and stick it  in... then pull it out... in, out,  in, out! Every day! There's no end  to it. You just keep coming and  COMING!... and the bill just gets  bigger and BIGGER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana braces herself against the sink, breathless... turne on by Ned's description. Ned goes to her, sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't see it, do you, Lana?  You're too good... too pure. You  can't see the evil in people like  him. (turns to Frank) Well, you're not getting away with  it, pal. I'm pulling the plug! You're  fired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) Ned... don't you have to be somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch) Oh... yeah. Thanks, honey. I'm late  for court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to kiss her mouth and she turns her cheek to him. looks at her lovingly... touches her face tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so naive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up his briefcase, gives Frank a nasty look, then exits thru the back door. Lana and Frank stare at each other lustfully, really hot  now! Frank sweeps the dishes off the table with his arm.  Lana leaps into his arms, wrapping her legs around his wa He lays her down on the kitchen table, standing over her. Suddenly, Ned opens the back door, glaring right at Frank not even noticing Lana on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish your coffee... then GET OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the door. A beat. Lana and Frank begin to devour each other with passionate kisses. Another beat. The fron doorbell RINGS once... then again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the postman. He always rings  twice.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richly appointed with stately oak, walls lined with law b As in all "Noir" thrillers, venetian blinds cast dramatic slashes of light and ceiling fans turn lazily in every ro Ned hurries in, rummaging through the files on his desk. LAURA, a strikingly lovely brunette, enters from the oute office, files in hand. She is Ned's astute, dedicated, se sacrificing "girl-friday" and legal secretary. She keeps life from spinning crazily apart. She absolutely adores h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura... do you know where...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him file) Right here. The judge decided to  skip arraignment and take Milo direct  to trial. You're six minutes late,  but don't sweat it. You got Judge  Allen. He's always eleven minutes  late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up a lawbook, flips it open to a dog-eared page

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suggest you try Lemming versus  Florida, 1956... where the guy jumped  in the water and everybody followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks about it) Yeah. Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles gratefully... drops the file into his briefcase Ned heads for the office washroom. Laura darts ahead of h into the washroom and turns the water on. Ned steps in... splashes some water on his face. Laura gr a towel from the rack where three small towels hang neatl hands it to Ned. He dries his face, looking at her with  genuine fondness and gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'd do without  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances toward the toilet, notices it hasn't been flu She FLUSHES it, lowers the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down on the toilet seat, watching him adoringly he shaves with an electric razor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura, how long have you worked for  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years, seven months, twenty-three  days, nineteen hours... (checks her watch) ...six minutes and fifty-two seconds. (softly, to herself) ...fifty-three... fifty-four... fifty- five... fifty-six...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when was the last time I gave  you a raise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura neatly folds the end of the toilet paper into a poi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never. But that's okay. I don't need  a raise. In fact... I was thinking  of giving you a rebate on my salary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks off the razor, turns to look at her for a long  moment, considering this, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. That's okay. You keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a manly pat on the shoulder then casually to the towel onto the rack, where it hangs sloppily askew... right next to her face. He exits. Laura stares at the towel with a tortured expression. The CAMERA PUSHES IN to her face as we see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrawled on a steamed-up bathroom mirror - FLASHBACK - CA COD - THREE YEARS EARLIER. A hand wipes the mirror off,  revealing Laura... younger, longer hair, with a nasty bla eye. LAURA'S HUSBAND appears behind her, glaring insanely. He  looks toward the towel rack. There are three towels... with HIS - HIS - HIS embossed a the bottom edge. One towel hangs longer than the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we forget something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She meekly lines up all the towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we forget something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She meekly lines up all the towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's Husband pulls the cupboard open. All the cans and boxes are neatly stacked in straight lines. All except on She straightens it... trembling with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her outside, nodding toward a line of tall PINE  trees behind the house. They are all straight and even... except one, whose tall branches tower conspicuously above the rest. He holds up a chainsaw, nodding toward the trees. Shaking and tearful... she backs into the house.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO LAURA
dialogues.text: SCREAMING out in terror! Ned rushes in, shaking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura. Laura! What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming out of it) I'm okay, I'm okay. I just get a  bit... claustrophobic... in the  bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should try some prune juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her shoulder a consoling squeeze, then exits. Sh shakily straightens the towels and regains her composure. Ned opens a wardrobe closet in his office. He walks along looking at thirty exactly identical blue suits, hanging  neatly. Laura follows behind him. He stops and stares,  indecisive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wear the blue one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned turns dramatically to face the jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen... I ask you...  does this look like the face of a  crook?

dialogues.speaker: MILO CRUMLEY
dialogues.text: sitting next to Laura at the defense table... STILL weari the panty hose over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it does. But the question  of my client's guilt or innocence is  not the issue here today. I'm certain  every member of the jury can clearly  see that he's guilty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Ned ignores this, turning to look directly at the CAMERA he addresses the jury... holding up a pair of nylon panty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put yourself in his shoes. Look  through his eyes. See the world the  way HE sees it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the pantyhose over the LENS, obscuring our view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things just don't look the same.  It's fuzzy... and frightening!

dialogues.speaker: TO INCLUDE NED AND JURY
dialogues.text: The nylon pantyhose are draped over the frightened face o WOMAN JUROR. All the other Jurors are holding up their ow socks and nylon stockings, trying to peer through them. Ned steps over to Milo, motioning toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen... Milo Crumley  is not the perpetrator here. He is  the VICTIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo unwraps a piece of bubble gum and pushes it into his panty-hose covered mouth, chewing the nylon and gum toget

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like ALL of us... this man is the  unfortunate victim of these tragically  difficult economic times. And what  does that mean? He can't support his  family!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned motions toward the gallery, where we SEE... ...MILO'S WIFE and TWO CHILDREN, all wearing panty hose o their faces. Ned motions toward Milo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake!... He can't even  support his own FACE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDGE ALLEN notices that Milo is chewing gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Crumley... you cannot chew gum  in my courtroom... unless you have  enough for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo holds up a big plastic bag filled with bubble gum. J Allen grabs it, takes a piece of gum and hands it to the  Bailiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bailiff. Pass these out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bailiff takes the bag, offers one to Ned... who takes piece, unwraps it and starts chewing. The Bailiff then  proceeds to pass out gum to EVERYONE in the courtroom. The JURY FOREMAN raises his hand and clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't forget the jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so, desperate and broke, with no  other options before him, Mr. Crumley  went to eleven Savings & Loans and  did what any of you would have done.  He stole back the money that the  S&Ls had stolen from him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courtroom erupts in CHEERS! Judge Allen raps the gave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Mr. Ravine... please approach the  bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. The Judge leans toward him, reaching out to cove the microphone, covering the end of the gavel instead. Th Judge's voice is AMPLIFIED over the courtroom speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not running for congress here,  so knock off the speeches and quit  inciting these brainless morons! Now  pick up the pace and wrap this son- of-a-bitch up! Call your first  witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned turns... looking out over the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call... Detective Ned Ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a surprised GASP from the crowd... and a loud MU The BAILIFF holds out a video box. It's titled HOLY BIBLE THE VIDEO. Ned puts one hand on it, raises the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you swear to tell the truth, the  whole truth and nothing but the truth,  so help you God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned sits down... then gets up, his demeanor changing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Ravine, at the time of the  arrest, did you read the defendant  his Miranda rights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slips back into the witness box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. That's standard procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned steps over to Arch, who is sitting in the first row o the gallery. Arch hands him the Miranda "cue cards."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are these the cards Officer Brooks  used to prompt you while reading Mr.  Crumley his rights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lays them on the corner of the stand... then slips int the chair. He picks the cards up and flips thru them. On back we can see scribbled... "NED'S IDIOT CARDS"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. These are them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned jumps to his feet, pacing dramatically, grabbing the  cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reading from the cards now... quote  "You have the right to remain silent,  if you waive that right, anything  you say... may be used against you  in a court of law." Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back in the chair) That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands up, announces) WRONG! The official Miranda warning  is... "anything you say CAN be used  against you in a court of law." Not  "may"... "CAN!" (on the attack) Don't you know the difference between  "can" and "may", Detective? Every  school kid knows "can" is a verb  that indicates ability to perform,  while "may" is a verbal auxiliary  indicating the permission to act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned pivots into the witness stand, changing his attitude  from aggressive attorney to defensive, angry witness as h hits the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have time to worry about  past participles or interrogative  pronouns! I was trying to protect  society from a deranged MADMAN! (leaps up, pointing) But this ivy league fop...!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courtroom ERUPTS! The Judge bangs the gavel. Ned stri proudly toward the defense table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no more use for this witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ravine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned turns. The Judge motions with a finger for Ned to app the bench. Ned does, resting his hand on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dismissing this case on the  grounds of improper grammar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge smacks Ned's hand with a ruler!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumps up) But your Honor...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. It's a technicality.  But it's the kind of technicality  that makes the American legal system  what it is today! Court's adjourned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge mistakenly picks up the microphone and whacks i on the bench like a gavel. BAM! BAM! BAM! It is DEAFENING Everyone covers their ears in pain. The THX Sound System Logo appears at the bottom of the  screen... along with "The Courtroom Is Listening"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned turns the key... enters through the private door. He  HEARS the plaintive sound of a saxophone playing Lola's  Theme... his eyes drawn to the slightly opened door to th outer office.

dialogues.speaker: NED'S POV THRU OPENING
dialogues.text: A gorgeous pair of legs, sleek nylons, high-heeled shoes. There are several CANDY WRAPPERS, CIGARETTE BUTTS and oth pieces of TRASH stuck to the bottom of one shoe.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: pushes the door open. It's Lola. She wears a tight white  dress, long white gloves and broad-brimmed hat. The hat t up slowly, revealing her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited. You never came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned reaches in his pocket, pulls out a wet paper towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got busy. Here's that paper towel  I promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in? The door was locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola proudly holds up a tiny bobbie pin. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's miraculous what a real woman  can do... with a bobbie pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned looks at the door. The frame and lock have been bruta chewed away, as if someone used a jackhammer on them! She pulls out a pack of cigarettes... BLACK LUNG LITES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering) Cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... thanks. They're bad for ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the water cooler. She lights up, exhaling a so cloud of smoke through a sleepy smile, her voice purring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know. I like things that are  bad for me. (touching lawbooks) So... I hear you go both ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned hesitates... about to drink from the paper cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only once. It was a fraternity prank.  I never saw him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gulps the water down, crumbles the cup in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean... you're a cop and a  lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Well, there's a lot of  scum out there on the streets... but  they all deserve a fair and costly  trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned turns, tries to casually "dunk" the crumpled cup in t waste basket. He misses. Laura enters with a huge pile of lawbooks in her arms. Sh sees Ned miss the basket and darts over as he bends down pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks it up and tosses it into the waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Laura... this is, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola Cain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura sets the heavy load of books on the desk and steps  toward Lola, extending her hand. Lola takes her time remo the long white glove... finally reaching out and shaking  Laura's hand with a condescending air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) So lovely to meet you, Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned grabs the books and turns to the bookshelf, replacing each lawbook in its proper slot. The "handshake" between Lola and Laura turns tense, then  aggressive, eventually becoming a "standing Indian wrestl as they try to force each other off balance with sheer fo Ned is oblivious to the battle behind him, chattering awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta keep these darn books in their  right place or we'll never find the  ones we need. Let's see, Q thru M...  R thru B... W thru F...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura suddenly whirls Lola around, putting her in an arm  lock. But Lola elbows Laura in the stomach! Laura doubles over. Lola feigns sympathy, taking her hand... then spins twisting Laura's arm, flipping her head over heels! Laura lands on the couch... upside down... gasping. Lola  strikes a haughty pose, still holding her lit cigarette. takes a drag. Laura checks her watch, then tumbles off th couch, landing on her feet. She straightens her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting late. I'll give you a  ride home, Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished with the books, Ned turns... smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tow you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today. You don't need to wait.  I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola looks at Laura... icy, haughty, triumphant. Laura mo reluctantly toward the door, sees the lock and door frame chewed to pieces... whirls around, heads back toward Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should call someone to fix this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She instantly spins around, heads back toward the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and exits. Ned sits down on the corner of the desk. Lo sits in the chair across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I should warn you, Mr.  Ravine... I'm not wearing any  underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses her legs suggestively... then slowly, enticin re-crosses them in the other direction. Unimpressed, Ned opens Laura's desk drawer... pulls a pai of sexy lace panties from a Kleenex-style dispenser box  labeled "PANDORA'S POP-UP PANTIES"... which pulls another pair up into position. He tosses the panties to Lola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try these on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does... very, very slowly and seductively... as they  talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've run across some... papers...  and I thought you might be able to  tell me what they are. You see, I'm  not very experienced when it comes  to... papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you Miss Cain, if I'm able.  Do you have the... papers... here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... they're at home. I thought you  might stop by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on duty tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't they ever give you a night  off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up cigarette) Why don't we meet tomorrow evening  then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finishes pulling the panties on with a sultry smile.. "snapping" the elastic waistband. She goes to the door,  pauses... turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll let you know where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steps over to her) What's wrong with my office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around, exhaling another cloud of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing a good interior decorator  couldn't fix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door. Behind her, in the hall, we see Dizzy the saxophone player, wailing away on "Lola's Theme."

dialogues.speaker: LOLA
dialogues.text: She takes a final, long drag on her cigarette, then reach O.S. with it... toward Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of this for me, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sultry smile, she turns and leaves, closing the do

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: The cigarette is stuck in his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door swings open. Frank is standing there, dres in a cheap, loose-fitting suit and a T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came back for my shower cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana, now wearing the diaphanous gown, pulls him inside. kisses him hungrily, slipping a frilly plastic shower cap with a gaudy floral design on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you came to the right  place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks to the living room. Frank follows, still wearin the shower cap. Lana snaps her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits in a chair, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On duty all night. By the time he  wraps up his reports, it'll be close  to noon tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the couch, picks up a stack of papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just reading over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at Frank. Sees the shower cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off the hat, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slips the shower cap off as Lana continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just reading over my husband's  insurance policies. You wouldn't  know anything about insurance, would  you, Frankie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, matter of fact, I sell policies  part-time. I got half a brain... or  didn't you notice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I musta had my eye on something else. (hands him papers) How about a translation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips through, scanning the pages, shrugging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard accident policy... all the  usual stuff... blah, blah, blah. The  face value is... Wow. Not bad. Three  million bucks! (flips page) And there's a triple indemnity rider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, it's just something agents throw  in so we can boost the premium. If  the policy holder dies under very  specific conditions, it pays off  three times the face value of the  policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine million dollars...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... but it's a sure bet for the  company. Nobody ever collects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, like here... it only pays off  if he's shot with a pistol, falls  from a moving northbound train and  drowns in a fresh water stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what I mean, sweetheart? What  are the odds of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could happen. (dramatic beat) Suppose it did happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'd be rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'd be rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you sayin'...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops to her knees in front of him, her face close to his, speaking with a persuasive urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna kill the son-of-a-bitch!  And I know exactly how! He has a  legal symposium in Santa Barbara  this weekend... All we have to do is  get him to take the train up instead  of driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we gonna do that? Didn't you  tell me he hates trains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where you come in, baby. You're  gonna rig his car so it doesn't work.  That should be no problem for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up, walks to the adjoining room... snapping her  fingers at her side. He follows. She steps to a table, pulls the cover off an elaborate sc model of Dealey Plaza and a train station, complete with Scale model trains chugging around the tracks. She uses a pointer to trace the route to the depot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... we give him a lift to the  train station... through Dealey Plaza,  past the Book Suppository and around  the grassy knoll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that out of our way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignoring this, she turns the LIGHTS OFF, walks over to a  screen and picks up a remote control. She clicks the butt A SLIDE PROJECTOR comes on, throwing an IMAGE on Frank's  back. We can read the words: THE PLAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves over. "THE PLAN" appears on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she talks, IMAGES appear on the screen, accompanying h rapid spiel. We see: a shot of the depot, a map of the ra route, a gun, a river, a Bingo game, baseball action and huge dollar sign!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes out of the station he'll  be standing in the vestibule between  cars... trying to avoid a panic  attack. Fourteen minutes and ten  seconds out, the train crosses the  Santa Ynez River. So at thirteen  minutes and fifty-four seconds, I  shoot him, shove him out the door...  he hits the river and drowns. Bingo!  A triple play. We're rich!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights click ON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been thinking about this a lot,  haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It just came to me. (closer, seductive) I had this image of a big, powerful,  throbbing train... plunging into a  long, dark, wet tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace, kissing passionately, dropping out of frame The model train CHUGS faster, the train whistle SHRIEKING long "Woooooooo-woooooooooo!"... racing into a model tunn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned and Arch drag in a bunch of bad-ass, multi-ethnic GAN MEMBERS they've just busted. Ned angrily shoves one of th toughest gang members against the wall... losing his cool

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand over there and shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, we got rights! Don't you  be layin' no deleterious malfeasance  on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned goes ballistic and slams him into the wall again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth, punk! I don't want  to hear language like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch grabs Ned by the shoulder, pulling him back, calming him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, hold on, hoss! Take it easy.  You seem a little tense tonight.  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned regains his composure. He's depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw... I don't know. I guess it's  Lana. It's just... I know she wants  to have a baby so bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gang Member #1 steps closer, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I never get to spend any time  with her. And when I am home... it's  like she's, you know... avoiding  sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gang Member #1 steps closer, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should try to be more sensitive,  man. More romantic. Bring her flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps between them, putting his arm around Ned's shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to understand how she feels.  After all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps back, begins to SING "Try A Little Tenderness"..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She may be weary... Women do get  weary... Wearing that same old shabby  dress... But when she's weary... Try  a little ten-der-ness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Gang Members join in on the SECOND VERSE with a sweet, mellow street-corner harmony as back-up... and som smooth group choreography. The COPS on duty listen raptly, getting maudlin and dewey eyed. Tears roll down the cheeks of the BOOKING SERGEANT. The lights dim. A big, gruff COP makes eyes at a HOOKER b booked... and they start to slow dance. Arch watches all this with a sentimental smile, munching his Nachos. When the song ends, Arch puts a comforting ha covered with Nacho cheese, on Ned's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be it. I'm the tenderest  guy on the force. Nah... I think  she's just afraid she won't be able  to get pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to be afraid! It's like making  breakfast! You bring home the bacon...  she's got the eggs. Ya scramble it  up. Ba-da-boom ba-da-bing! She's got  an omelette in the oven! (a beat, then) Why don't you knock off early... go  home. It'd be nice for Lana to wake  up in the morning and find you there  for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw... I can't. I got all this  paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do our own paperwork, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! We'll fill out all that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned nods, smiles and gratefully "high-fives" the Gang Mem as he heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is dark. A key turns in the lock and Ned enters

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: It's dark. Ned quietly undresses and slips into bed.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: Sunlight creeps through the windows. Lana's eyes flutter  open. She sees Ned beside her... sleeping. Suddenly, it h her. She turns! Frank is on the other side, curled up,  snoring. She's laying between both men! Lana elbows Frank. He stirs, groggy. She covers his mouth indicating Ned. Frank's eyes bug out! He slips out of bed The bed frame SQUEAKS LOUDLY! Frank freezes. Ned sleeps o steadily. Frank grabs his clothes. An unending torrent of coins fal out of his pants pockets, CLANGING on the floor! He freez Ned sleeps on. Frank retrieves the coins, clumsily steppi on the TV REMOTE CONTROL. A high-tech, sleekly designed TELEVISION MONITOR rises up clicks ON. Frank tries frantically to push the set down, it keeps rising into position. An IMAGE appears. It's WIL SCOTT, doing the weather on the TODAY SHOW. Frank grabs the remote control, frantically pounding on a the buttons. The VOLUME goes up... SOUND BLASTING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on television) ...and Mrs. Prudy Ann Camomile of  Delphi, Georgia is one-hundred and  thirteen! What a gorgeous hunk of  female! Smokes three cigars a day,  drinks a straight shot of vodka at  bedtime... and still has sex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alarm clock goes off, CLANGING LOUDLY! Lana dives for it, slamming her hand down, killing the alarm. Going for a double-play, she flings the clock at the TV,  nailing the on/off switch! Silence. Ned is still out cold Frank moves toward the door... but with each step the flo CREAKS LOUDLY! He turns the knob. It CLUNKS! He pulls the door open v-e-r-y s-l-o-w-l-y and it CRE-E-E-E-A-K-S like the piercing metal brakes of a train! He blows Lana a kiss, then pulls the door closed very gen It sticks. He pulls harder. The knob pops off in his hand and he falls backward, tumbling down the stairs with a HU RACKET! Ned doesn't stir. Finally it's SILENT. Lana exhal A SMALL BIRD lands on the sill of the open window, trilli a sweet little "CHIRP." Ned sits bolt upright, irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn birds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his shoe, heaving it toward the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank glances back up at the bedroom window with an arrog smirk. WHAP! Ned's shoe hits him right in the face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned comes down the courthouse steps. He pauses in the str glimpsing the back of a WOMAN passing nearby... a STUNNIN BLOND decked out in a clinging dress and fashionable hat. a long strip of toilet paper trailing from her high heel  shoe. It must be LOLA. He turns to watch her. A HORN BLARES! BRAKES SCREECH! The SOUND OVERLAPS to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Ned enters, looking terrible. Suit ripped hair messed up, bruised and battered, briefcase crushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, Ned... you look like you  were hit by a bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was. (notices) Who's in my office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max Shady's mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not again.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE OFFICE
dialogues.text: MRS. SHADY, an older woman with a pleasant appearance, si in an overstuffed leather chair. Ned and Laura enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs. Shady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned goes straight to his office closet, pulls out an iden blue suit... and starts stripping off his tattered clothe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura... check on my insurance. Make  sure it's paid up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura reluctantly returns to the outer office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea, Mr. Ravine. My son, Max,  is getting out of prison tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch) Gee, has it been seven years already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven long, miserable years in the  slammer. And he's a bit pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, being locked in a tiny room  with no TV can make a guy feel pretty  tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very concerned about him, Mr.  Ravine. He said you were a two-bit  shyster... and he's going to rip  your head off and use it for a bowling  ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to her, putting a comforting hand on her shoulder looking her right in the eye, attempting to provide solac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure the experience wasn't all  negative. He probably made a lot of  friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ever hopeful) You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...learned a useful trade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes... live autopsies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...caught up on all those books he  wanted to read...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles to her feet feebly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe so... but he said he's going  to punch you in the testicles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hauls off and PUNCHES him like a pile driver! WHAM! H doubles over, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...smash your face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She KNEES him in the face, raising him up... then nails h with a devastating RIGHT CROSS, spinning him around. He  collapses over the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and decimate your wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the tail of his suit jacket and rips it up the  back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I wouldn't want that to happen. (spanks his butt) He's a naughty naughty boy. I just  thought I should warn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and shuffles out, passing through the outer off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Laura) Bye for now. (pauses by desk) Oh... may I have a cookie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at file cabinet) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a handful of cookies and casually flings them a Laura... as she heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank yooooooooou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura rushes into Ned's office with the file folder. He  staggers unsteadily by the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate when she comes to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you realize, Ned?... you could  be in real danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees file) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extreme peril. You know, the risk of  personal bodily harm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at file) No... I mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your insurance file. But the policy's  missing. Did you take it home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura looks puzzled... wondering where it might be. Then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wait a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to her desk in the outer office, digs through a  drawer. Suddenly, she GASPS! She is holding...

dialogues.speaker: A FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: of her abusive HUSBAND... sneering. A circle has been dra around his head with lipstick and a diagonal line slashed across his face.

dialogues.speaker: HER HUSBAND'S FACE
dialogues.text: peers out through a sailboat porthole at stormy seas. A p of masking tape stuck to the glass matches the diagonal l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's Husband turns from the porthole. Laura cowers. The boat pitches and heaves, disturbing all the neatly hu towels, emblazoned with MINE - MINE - MINE across the bot edge. Laura's Husband reacts with a crazed look in his ey Laura makes a break for it, running up on deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's Husband scrambles up onto the deck, looking fore aft. Laura's vanished! He looks out to sea, calling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lau-raaaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura paddles ashore, grasping a little kid's inflatable  float ring. She struggles onto the sand and looks out to  sea, triumphant... tossing the plastic float aside.

dialogues.speaker: ULTRA CONTEMPO BEACH HOUSE
dialogues.text: -- Laura rushes in, tracking water all through the house. -- Laura cuts an inch of hair from her amazingly long, ve wet tresses, then puts on a WIG... that is also LONG and

dialogues.speaker: WET
dialogues.text: -- Laura retrieves a bra and a package of Twinkies from a secret hiding place... and stuffs them into a small brown paper bag. -- Laura hurriedly mops up her water tracks, then... -- She uses an industrial buffer to wax the hardwood floo -- Laura removes her wedding ring... throws it in the toi She reaches for the handle to flush it... hesitates, seei the "CONSERVE WATER - THIS MEANS YOU!" sticker on the toi She reaches into the bowl and retrieves the ring. -- On the deck, Laura throws the wedding ring toward the  ocean. A SEAGULL swoops down, snatching it in mid-air and flies off.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script. -- In the bathroom... the Seagull flies in through the op window, lands on the back of the toilet and drops the rin into the toilet bowl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's Husband reaches into the surf and picks up the  deflated float ring. He looks at it with a cruel sneer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's Husband fishes Laura's wedding ring out of the to bowl... looking off with demonic rage!

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA PULLS BACK
dialogues.text: from Laura's SCREAMING mouth! Her eyes are filled with pu terror! A GIGANTIC wave of WATER splashes in her face! We see Ned... holding a tiny empty paper cup in his hand. Laura is completely drenched!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura! Are you alright? That was a  very long flashback you had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snaps out of it, sputtering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I know. It's okay. I'm just a  little... pre-menstrual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to her desk, still upset. She picks up the messa spike and turns to Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Lola Cain... "person"... stopped  by. She left this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thrusts it toward Ned's face! There's a business card stuck on the end. He pulls it off.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE ON BUSINESS CARD
dialogues.text: It reads: LE HOT CLUB! No Air Conditioning... And Proud O It! Scribbled next to it is the message... "Meet me at 7: The edges of the card are scorched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark, seductive, smoky, crowded... and HOT. Everybod is dripping with sweat and holding unlit cigarettes. Ned enters, sees Lola sitting on a stool at the bar, one crossed provocatively over the other. A beer can is stuck the gum on the bottom of her shoe. It falls off with a CL He sits on the stool next to her. She looks at him, smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, before I forget... you asked  me to take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his jacket pocket, pulls out a LIT CIGARE It has a very long ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes it... inhales a drag, then lets the smoke flow through her smile. It flows out for a loooooooooong time! More smoke than she could ever have inhaled. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smoke too much. (looks around, then) It's hot tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? I never know. My body heat  runs about twenty degrees above  normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices the drink in her hand is BOILING. A saxophone  begins to softly wail Lola's Theme. Ned looks over to see QUARTET, featuring Dizzy on sax. The GUITARIST spontaneou bursts into FLAME! A FIREMAN, in full gear, jumps up from the bar and puts out the blaze with a fire extinguisher.  None of the band members miss a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should look for a cooler  place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt we'll find one. Even the  wind chimes on my porch aren't moving  much these days. They keep thudding  softly, like dairy cows bumping butts  in the night. I go out there expecting  to find a cool breeze... but it's  just a lot of hot air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned glances at the MALE CUSTOMERS... sitting at the bar a from them. They're staring coldly at Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're they lookin' at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of them have tried that seat.  You're the first one's lasted this  long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel honored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. It's broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of realization, then the stool collapses with a CR Ned pulls himself back up and drags another stool over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring the... papers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I thought you might come over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I'll drive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought my own car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll follow you then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it sounds silly, but would  you leave first... wait in your car?  I come here a lot and I wouldn't  want those men to think I'm "easy"...  a slut who'll jump into bed with  anyone at the drop of a hat. But if  you leave first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...they'll think I'm a putz for  passing up a sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola stares at Ned for a long moment... then SLAPS his fa He doesn't move, remaining staunchly macho. Then, suddenl she SLUGS HIM so hard it knocks him over the top of the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for all to hear) Now leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses to give him a flicker of a COY SMILE... then p up her drink and moves to a nearby table. Ned struggles t his feet and staggers to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned is a mess! Blood trickles from the side of his mouth. Shirt soaked in sweat. He turns the radio ON. LOLA'S THEM starts playing. A small ceiling fan hangs from the interior roof of his c turning slowly. The venetian blinds on his side windows a partially open, letting in slashes of dramatic light.

dialogues.speaker: HIS POV OF ROAD
dialogues.text: He's following Lola's car. It signals and turns left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still hot, Ned pulls the chain on the ceiling fan. It spi faster. MUCH faster! The car becomes like a wind tunnel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cars enter a long drive, coming to a stop near a  large two story house surrounded by lush greenery. Ned climbs out... his wind-blown hair flattened on one si and sticking out crazily.

dialogues.speaker: LOLA'S CAR DOOR
dialogues.text: It opens. Lola's legs swing out. The CAMERA PANS DOWN her long legs to her feet. The car floormat is stuck to one s She casually shakes it off... going to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter. It's DARK. Ned squints into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here we are... in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have The Clapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola CLAPS her hands twice and all the LIGHTS COME ON. Sh smiles at him... drops her car keys on the hall table, th goes up the stairs. Ned drops his car keys on the table too and follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola clicks on a porch light. She and Ned step out. Dozen of small boxes hang around the perimeter of the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wind chimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned steps over, running his hands along the boxes. They " against each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, these would work a lot  better if you took them out of the  boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slips several boxes off, releasing clusters of the met chimes. They "tinkle" and "clang" melodically in the bree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well well... I guess you have been  around. I'm impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves close, coming on to him. Ned feels uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we take a look at those...  papers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering) Papers. Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola comes in, looks around, then down. She removes her s pulling off two scraps of paper stuck to the gum on her h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned is looking through a book... "KAMIKAZE KAMA SUTRA - T Encyclopedia of Deadly Sexual Positions." Lola comes back in, hands Ned the two scraps of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? These are the... papers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They're so confusing to me. Can  you tell me what they are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks them out... shrugs. It's obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's a laundry receipt... and  the other one's an expired lottery  ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands them back to her, but she gently pushes them awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You keep them... as a memento of  our time together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slips them into his jacket pocket... then sensuously  slides her hands around him, grabbing his buns, pulling h closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so grateful. How can I ever repay  you for all you've done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash would be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there some other way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose you could wash my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean, isn't there something  else you want? Something I could  give you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seductively starts to slide the jacket off his should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... slow down... there's a speed  limit in this state. Sixty-five miles  an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How fast was I going, officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, about a hundred and twenty-three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose you pull me over and frisk  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose I let you off with a warning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose I find a cop with a bigger  nightstick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose I put you under arrest for  being a bad girl with bad thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose you handcuff me to the bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapid run-on) Suppose I do and then we lose the  key and while I'm gone to get a  duplicate made the house catches on  fire and I can't get back to save  you because the bridge is washed out  and so you die a horrible death  toasted like a Polish sausage on a  flaming spit! (shakes his head) Nah... I better be going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and leaves. She is stunned, confused, breathless

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned opens the door, pauses, turns... as Lola joins him th She looks into his eyes with desire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not so tough. Last chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves her lips close to his, about to kiss him. Then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. I got a cold shower and a  wife who trusts me waiting at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Don't you want  me? It's the way I look, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps out, pauses... turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget to lock up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned pulls the door shut. The lock CLICKS. He pauses by hi car, realizing something, heaves a sigh, goes back to the door. He tries the knob, but the door is locked. He looks throu the small window. He sees Lola standing inside... breathi heavily, bracing herself against the staircase bannister, hand to her heaving chest as if to calm a pounding heart. He pushes against the door. It won't budge. He goes to th large window, gazing inside. She slides one hand enticing across her breast and thigh, striking a seductive pose. He points toward the door, motioning for her to unlock it She looks away. Frustrated, Ned tries the window. It's lo He picks up a wrought iron chair, SLAMS it into the windo The heavy chair falls apart. The glass doesn't even vibra He sees a riding power mower in the driveway... jumps int the seat, starts the engine... barreling toward the front the house! THUNDER CRASHES and LIGHTNING FLASHES in the s He PLOWS into the side of the house, SMASHING a huge hole thru the wall!... MOWING a swath in the carpet! Lola GASPS. Ned climbs off the mower, moving toward her. opens her arms, breathless. The MUSIC SWELLS dramatically She intercepts him, embracing him passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking past her) I forgot my car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struggles free, grabbing his car keys from the hall ta She follows, embracing him again, even more tenaciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what you came back for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impatient, she crushes her mouth against his, kissing him hard, desperately clawing at his clothes. She's relentles devouring him with her lips and tongue. Overwhelmed, he succumbs to her passion. His car keys dro from his hand. She pushes him down toward the floor.

dialogues.speaker: AT FLOOR LEVEL
dialogues.text: Her hands grasp his shirt, ripping it open. The buttons f in all directions! She grabs at his leather belt, twistin it in her hands... ripping it in two! She grabs his pants by the cuffs... rips one pant leg off Then the other!... tossing them over each shoulder! Ned and Lola tumble across the floor, arms and legs  entangled... rolling themselves up in a rug in the proces

dialogues.speaker: FIREPLACE
dialogues.text: A roaring fire. We HEAR O.C. MOANING and HEAVY BREATHING. The CAMERA TILTS DOWN to a sheepskin rug in front of the  fireplace. No one is there! A crystal vase falls, CRASHIN on the stone hearth. The CAMERA TILTS UP to REVEAL Ned an Lola... stretched out on the mantle, ravishing each other

dialogues.speaker: THE REFRIGERATOR
dialogues.text: The door suddenly BURSTS OPEN! Ned and Lola tumble out... wrapped in each other's arms, food tumbling out with them

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: THE DINING ROOM TABLE
dialogues.text: The table wiggles. The CAMERA MOVES UP to REVEAL Ned and  Lola kissing passionately. She lays on the table, arms an legs stretched upward... a spinning plate balanced on the pointed finger of each hand... and a large spinning platt balanced on the end of her pointed left toe. Her right fo brushes the platter to keep it spinning. The Ed Sullivan  Show position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ned and Lola's entangled legs, moving under the sheets -- Ned sitting, wrists tied to the brass bed with silk  scarves. -- Lola, also with her wrists tied to the bed with silk  scarves. -- Then... A WIDER ANGLE... revealing that they are BOTH  tied... at opposite ends of the same bed!

dialogues.speaker: THE BASEMENT STAIRS
dialogues.text: Wrapped in each other's arms, they tumble down the stairs crashing into a workbench, still kissing passionately!

dialogues.speaker: A WALL SOCKET
dialogues.text: Ned's hand plugs in a cord. RACK FOCUS to a soft lamb's w BUFFER WHEEL rising into frame, WHIRRING. It dips into an open can of FLOOR WAX... then moves over to Lola's naked  body, buffing the surface of her skin to a high gloss. Th CAMERA MOVES to her EYES. They're CROSSED in ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM FLOOR
dialogues.text: HEAVY BREATHING. SQUEAKY BED NOISES. The CAMERA MOVES up  along the mattress. The bed moves with a jerky rhythm. Th CAMERA REVEALS Lola's hand, grasping the sheet tightly. W MOVE UP to Lola, lying face down against the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) ...don't... stop...

dialogues.speaker: THE BED
dialogues.text: Ned jumps up and down on the bed like a trampoline! Lola on her stomach, bouncing each time Ned's feet hit the bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Oh Ned... please... don't...  stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does a complete BACK FLIP!... then keeps bouncing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind blows. THUNDER and LIGHTNING! RAIN pours down. Ned and Lola, both in yellow rain slickers, ravish each o lustfully on the roof, sliding down the incline of shingl Oblivious to the peril, they slip right over the edge! They hang from the eaves trough, each clutching it with o hand while still holding one another with their free arms kissing passionately. The trough breaks! They fall!

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND BELOW
dialogues.text: They roll out of the bushes onto the lawn, arms and legs  entangled. They fall apart, gasping for breath. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That takes care of foreplay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned's eyes widen. Lola grins lustily, rolling on top of h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cell wall is a clutter of PHOTOS: Hitler... Mussolini Charles Manson... and his mother, Mrs. Shady. A man's muscular naked torso rises into frame, his back t us. He's doing pull-ups, his body covered with TATTOOS! Quotes on each arm... "Don't have a cow, man!" - Bart  Simpson... and "I know you are, but what am I?" - Pee Wee Herman. On one shoulder, a gravestone with the epitaph "I told yo was sick!" In the center of his back... we see a big tattoo of Ned's face labeled "DEAD MEAT." A GUARD opens the cell door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
