dialogues.text: The prisoner turns. He's butt-ugly, hard, nasty looking.  It's MAX SHADY... with a HUGE "Double Corona" CIGAR in hi mouth. On his chest is a tattoo that reads: THIS SPACE FO RENT. He walks right toward the CAMERA LENS and the FRAME goes TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two huge iron doors swing open and a mob of milling REPOR rushes forward, surrounding Max Shady. He wears a blue su just like Ned's. The Reporters have no microphones, but s their empty hands at Max as if they do. They shout questi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Shady! What's the first thing  you're gonna do now that you're out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Ned Ravine... rip his head off  and use it for a bowling ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a good bowler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever bowled a three-hundred game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you handle a seven-ten  split?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, aren't you wearing one of  Ravine's "trademark" blue suits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The bastard gave it to me as a  gift... to make up for losing my  case. Now I'm going to wear it to  his friggin' funeral!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shady sees someone o.s., waves like a gleeful little kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ceiling fan rotates slowly... a pair of shorts and a ny stocking hanging from the blades. The house is a wreck! The CAMERA MOVES DOWN to Ned and Lola, both reclining in big claw-foot bathtub, facing each other, their arms drap lazily over the sides. Ned's eyes are closed. "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" plays on the stereo in the b.g. Lola's hand reaches for an ICE PICK on the floor, raising up slowly. Then... CLICK!... ignites the cigarette lighte in the handle, touching the flame to the end of her cigar She chips away a big chunk of ice from the block in a sil ice bucket beside her... then sensuously rubs the ice acr her breasts. Ned winces at the sight of this. Lola smiles at him, then lets the chunk of ice slide into the water... and pushes it between Ned's legs. He cringes eyes crossed. The familiar repetition of MUSICAL notes fr the stereo DRONES LOUDER... grabbing Ned's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Madam Butterfly, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iron Butterfly. In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listening) Oh yeah, sure... now I can hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It tells the sad story of a woman  who is rejected by her lover after a  brief, but torrid, affair... so she  stalks him with an ice pick and stabs  him with it more than a thousand  times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I never could understand the  lyrics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts his feet out of the water, dangles them over eac side of the tub. He's still wearing one blue sock. Lola r her feet out of the water. She's still wearing her high h shoes. They are dripping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, what happened last night  was very, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... it was. I should check on my  homeowners insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can't ever let it happen again.  Ever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying, Ned? That you're  rejecting me, your lover, after a  brief, but torrid, affair?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned pulls his feet in, sits up... suddenly feeling vulner He measures his words very, very carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't put it exactly like that.  It's just that... well, I'm married  to a wonderful woman... who is very,  very attractive... (but adds quickly) ...not that you aren't very  attractive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice begins to ECHO and FADE as the CAMERA MOVES IN a CU of Lola's enraged EYES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice echoing) ...you aren't very attractive... you  aren't very attractive... you aren't  very attractive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then WE SEE... A CLOSE SHOT of her hand, grasping the ice pick... scratc it along the side of the tub, peeling back the porcelain. GRATING SCREECH OVERLAPS to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT on a SCREECHING TROPICAL BIRD. We PULL BACK to reve Ned looking around the store. His ripped pants have been  temporarily repaired with big pieces of masking tape. A C steps over with two big Parrots on her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch anything. You bond with  it... you buy it. Whatdya want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to buy a pet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She eyes him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. For what purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a gift... for my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. They all say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spends a lot of time alone. I  thought it might be nice if she had  something to keep her company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. I bet. How do I know  you're not the kind of guy who punches  out parakeets? Or takes some poor  defenseless animal, throws it in a  sack and runs over it with your car  five or six times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never hurt an animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I would. They're driving me  CRAZY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns and SHOUTS at the noisy birds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shuddup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do. She turns back to Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... tell me more about this broad  you're married to. I like to match  people with the pets they deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A typical police squad room... smoke-filled, cluttered, b Arch sits at a desk doing paperwork, surrounded by the Ga Members... who are also filling out papers. Arch SINGS to himself, munching on nachos from a big pile of chips. The Gang Members harmonize with him. A Gang Member reaches for a nacho chip. Arch grabs for th gun in his shoulder holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gang Member drops the chip. Arch pops it in his mouth continues singing. The Gang Members join in with harmony. Ned enters in the background, carrying a box with airhole in it. He steps over to his desk, looking at the singing  Gang Members, then motions like a choir leader, cutting t off neatly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doubtful) You do all my paperwork?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all hand over their completed paperwork. Ned stares them for a beat... surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do. He opens the files... checks out the papers. Arc notices something O.S. and gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a damn good job, too. One of 'em  even did it in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch turns the sound up on a wall-mounted TV monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Ned! Catch this! Friend of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen... it's Max Shady speaking to the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.) ...I'd like to reach down Ned Ravine's  throat and pull out his guts with my  bare hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Jesus... you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just working through his anger,  trying to find a constructive outlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kiddin'! He'll do it! The  guy's a friggin' looney!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I spent a lot of time with  him when I was preparing his case.  He's really a very sweet, sensitive  human being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.) I'd like to mash his head like a  ripe melon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets a little melon-dramatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.) ...then cut off all his fingers and  rip out his liver with my teeth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) See. Loves to exaggerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch slumps in his chair, really stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Ned... you're in deep shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned laughs it off. He starts checking through the message and paperwork on his desk. The PHONE RINGS. He picks it u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned's face darkens. He turns away.

dialogues.speaker: LOLA'S MOUTH
dialogues.text: Speaking into the phone... intense, obsessive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see you, Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering harshly) I told you not to call me! It's  finished between us. No. No, I'm not  sucking anything of yours anymore! (voice gets louder) It's done! OVER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SLAMS the receiver down, shattering the phone! Everyon stares at Ned in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs it off) Wrong number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in the bathtub, phone receiver in one hand, still  jabbing at the porcelain tub with the ice pick. Water squ from the holes she's punctured in the side of the tub. Sh flings the ice pick at the wall. It sticks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana is seated on a park bench wearing a trenchcoat, hat sunglasses. Frank walks up, looks around nervously, prete not to know Lana. He sits down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come we gotta meet here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to be careful now. We can't  risk being seen together at the house  or someone might connect us to the  murder later on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... put this on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her sunglasses off, looks at him. He hesitates, staring at the hat. A dignified looking OLDER GENTLEMAN  approaches. Frank quickly slips the hat on his head. The Older Gentleman sits on the bench across from them. H opens a paper sack and begins neatly laying his lunch out next to him. An apple, sandwich, napkin, Mountain Dew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Frank) Speak Yiddish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Yiddish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the SUB-TITLE "Speak Yiddish." From this point on, all their dialog is in YIDDISH... but it appears in ENGLI SUB-TITLES across the bottom of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ich hobe getracht, efsher iz der  nisht geshtoigen un nisht gefloygen. (I been thinkin'...  maybe this plan is  too complicated.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zein nisht azoy meshige! Der plan iz  kosher vi yosher. (Quit worrying. The  plan is perfect.)

dialogues.speaker: ANGLE ON OLDER GENTLEMAN
dialogues.text: He tosses crumbs of his sandwich to the pigeons, occasion glancing up at Frank and Lana. Whenever they speak, howev his eyes look down toward their legs.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIUM TWO-SHOT ON FRANK AND LANA
dialogues.text: with SUB-TITLES across the bottom of screen, about knee-l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Ober mir darfen imvarfen in tsug.  Un schissen un schtippen in vasser  arein. Oy a broch! Mir zenen git  bakackt. (Yeah, but we gotta  get him on the train,  shoot him... then  push him in the river.  There's a million  ways we can screw  up.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vus iz mit idr? Die host a vaichen  schmoke? (You're not going  soft on me, are you?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ven hob ich gehat a vaichen schmoke? (When have I ever  gone soft on you?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lest'n Yomkippur. (Last Yom Kippur.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nu shoin, ein mul. Es paseert tsie  yeyden man. (Okay... once! It  happens to every  guy.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oy! Mir vellen zein oif groise tsures.  Me'vet unz chap'n. (We're going to be in  big trouble. They're  going to catch us.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's very little risk involved.  Statistics reveal that less than  thirty-two percent of all murderers  are ever apprehended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look at him... stunned. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak Yiddish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I can read sub-titles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Lana are speechless. But across the bottom of t screen we see a SUB-TITLE reflecting their thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oy vay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned enters, carrying the box. He sets it down on her desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh gee, you shouldn't have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. It's for my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into his office, starts to change out of his tatt suit. Laura talks to him from the outer office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She called. Wondered why you never  came home last night. I told her you  were working with a client,  undercover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps into the doorway of his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's lipstick on your collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She returns to her desk. Disturbed, Ned quickly pulls the shirt collar out, checks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No there isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... there isn't. But you answered  my question. She's a real looker,  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola Cain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hadn't noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the blinds behind her and looks at Ned through window between their offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I noticed how you hadn't  noticed. (returns to work) That's alright. She noticed enough  for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up a stack of papers from the FAX machine. Ned  steps into the doorway, wearing a clean shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worry about you, Ned. I worry a  lot. (hands him papers) Max Shady's been faxing death threats  to you all morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading bits) ...stick a knife in your... (reacts, next) ...rip the eyeballs out of your... (next) ...drive razor-sharp spikes under  your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get to the one...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...cut it off... shove it in a  blender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tosses them aside) He's just getting it out of his  system. Once they say it... they  never do it. You know... like the  President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK at the door. They look up to see an omino SILHOUETTE of a MAN on the milkglass. Ned starts toward t door. Laura grabs his arm, stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Wait. It might be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her purse, pulls out a big COLT .45, holding it out to him. Ned stares at it, taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if obvious) From my purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still obvious) Handing it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, Laura, what do you use a gun  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shoot it. A bullet comes out.  Gosh, Ned, after all your years as a  cop, I'd think you'd know these  things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura... put the gun away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the gun back to her... goes to the door... opens it. There's a young DELIVERY MAN holding a bouquet of flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks card) Flowers for Ned Rav... (looks up) Hey... aren't you that lawyer guy?  Man, you are dead meat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned grabs the flowers, slams the door. Laura takes the  envelope from the flowers... opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this another sick joke from Max  Shady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the card... her expression turning cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands it to him) Lola Cain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the flowers... takes them into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put these in water for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned opens the envelope. An audio cassette drops into his  hand. Written on the label: PLAY ME. From the bathroom, we hear the LOUD SOUND of a TOILET  FLUSHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining. Ned pops the cassette into the tape player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned, darling... I know this seems  like a strange way to talk with you...  but since you won't take my calls, I  have no other choice. (then suddenly) Watch it! That red car's turning  left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned swerves to avoid a collision, HONKING his horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Ned. We're meant to be  together... forever. (then suddenly) The light's changing! Floor it! Go!  Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned guns it!... accelerating through a yellow light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice move! (then sincere again) Nothing can keep us apart, Ned. Not  even your wife. I'd hate to have to  tell her about us, but if necessary...  I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see HEADLIGHTS behind Ned's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is following him, her eyes intense, obsessed. Dizzy s in the back seat, noodling softly on his saxophone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned steps into the living room carrying the box. Lana com down the stairs, pulling on a bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guilty as charged) Why? What have you heard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) You could have called. But then, I  suppose you were tied up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reflecting back) Only part of the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never know when you're coming home,  Ned. How can I ever make any plans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., through the window, WE SEE Frank drop from t second floor, right onto the seat of a waiting motorcycle He ZOOMS OFF into the night. Ned steps up behind Lana, slips his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise I'll spend more time with  you. I know it's been rough, being  alone so much. But I'll make it up  to you. Maybe we should try again,  you know... to have a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rolls her eyes at this... changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's in the box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I brought you a present!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands it to her. She opens it, looks in. She looks up, struggling unsuccessfully to hide a look of displeasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... sorta like a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned pulls out a PET SKUNK and puts it in Lana's lap. She  forces a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough like a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little skunk. I got it at  Birds-and-Skunks-R-Us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola stands in the pouring rain outside, drenched... star at Lana and Ned through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what're you going to name him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about... Ned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks about it) Yeah. Got a nice ring to it. I've  always liked the name Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arms around them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whatdya think? You love Ned Junior  as much as you love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS. Lana stands up, unceremoniously dropping the Skunk into Ned's arms. She goes into...

dialogues.speaker: THE ADJOINING ROOM
dialogues.text: ...to answer the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?... Hello?... Hello? (then, whispering) Frank? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola is in a glass telephone booth with venetian blinds a a ceiling fan. She cracks the blinds open. In the backgro through a window, we can see Lana in the house on the pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I told you not to call. Frank? FRANK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned enters the cavernous marble rotunda, turns down a hal crowded with milling attorneys and defendants. Lola sudde intercepts him... a newspaper trailing from her high heel shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank? The only Frank I know is an  auto mechanic... but I sure as hell  wouldn't recommend the guy. He's  really slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to move off, but she stops him, impassioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to see you, Ned. I need to  feel your arms around me! I wanna  suck your toes til the nails pop  off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola's voice ECHOES. BYSTANDERS gather, listening. Ned lo around self-consciously, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, what happened was a big  mistake. A one night stand. It's  over. I have a wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD presses closer... not missing a thing. A WOMAN  snaps a FLASH PICTURE! A MAN turns on his video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. She'll know all  about us soon anyway. I want YOU! In  my bed... in my arms... in MEEEEEEE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mortified, Ned spins on his heels and makes a bee-line fo the safety of the Men's Room. Lola holds up two tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got us tickets to see Iron  Butterfly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate opera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned bursts in, goes to the urinal... not noticing BEN ARU an older gentleman in a business suit, standing at the ur next to him. A beat later... Lola enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you running from me? Didn't  it mean ANYTHING to you?... buffing  my buns with carnuba wax? (looks down) Come on, Neddy-poo. Doesn't Mr. Pokey  want to go exploring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's busy right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arugula glances sideways at Ned, curious and uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I told you... Mr. Pokey made a  big mistake! One lousy mistake in  his whole stinkin' life! So why don't  you give him a BREAK! Besides... he  belongs to my wife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana FIRES her gun rapidly... BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG!...  over her shoulder, behind her back, under her leg.

dialogues.speaker: TARGET
dialogues.text: A full-body cut-out of a man, wearing one of Ned's tradem gray suits. A HUGE SMOKING HOLE has been blown right thro the crotch! Lana smirks, inhales the SMOKE from the gun  barrel... and blows it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT DOWN from an official government seal that reads "AR GRATIA ARTIS." JUDGE Ben Arugula... the distinguished loo gentleman from the men's room, sits on the bench. Ned, La and a SLIMY DEFENDANT stand at the defense table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to congratulate Mr. Pokey  for setting yet another unusual legal  precedent. This is the first time  I've ever tried a case in which the  JURY was found to be insane.

dialogues.speaker: JURY AND BAILIFF
dialogues.text: The BAILIFF is handing out straitjackets to all the JUROR The Jury Foreman struggles to get his on and laced up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to another Juror) What're you? A thirty-eight long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jury will be remanded to the  Center For Unclear Thinking in Simi  Valley. Court's adjourned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JURY is led from the courtroom in straitjackets and  chains. Ned and Laura follow them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your BIRTHDAY! Today? Why didn't you  tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not important. I just had one  last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm taking you out to celebrate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g. the Slimy Defendant pulls a gun and forces  CITIZENS... including Judge Arugula... up against the wal robbing them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no no! It's no big thing. I'll  have another one sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist. And I want to get you a  nice present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so sweet. You don't have to.  You gave me a present last year.  Those lovely Ginzu knives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... aren't they great! They last  forever. And you can cut right through  a shoe with 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk off, we HOLD ON a CLOSE SHOT of a newspaper. The headline reads: EX-CON STALKS COP/LAWYER NED RAVINE!  Below it is a picture of Max Shady, eyes wide with psycho rage... a huge cigar in his mouth, wearing a garish Hawai shirt. Hands lower the newspaper... revealing Max himself, with same cigar, shirt and crazed look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura models hats... each one becoming more outrageous. S coaxes Ned into joining her. They BOTH try on WOMEN's hat smiling and laughing... as "Brown Eyed Girl" plays. In one of the mirrors, we SEE Max Shady's reflection... a he also tries on women's hats, watching them, puffing his cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura wears a baseball cap with beer cans attached to eac side with long, curved plastic straws. The cap emblem rea "BEER BIMBO." A price tag hangs from it. She is beaming. In the b.g., Hawaiian DANCERS juggle flaming torches as t dance around an ICE SCULPTURE of a Hula Dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to be off the streets...  away from all the pain and misery  out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned motions casually toward the world "out there"... stic his thumb into the eye of a WAITER who is bending over to pick up a spoon, setting off a chaotic CHAIN REACTION of  small disasters that finally culminates with someone near the dance floor bumping into the Torch Juggler, throwing rhythm off. Distracted, he starts catching the FLAMING ENDS of the  torches! OW! OH! YI! OUCH! YIPES! He drops them all. The Waiter who bumped into him, polite picks up one of the flaming torches and hands it back to Torch Juggler. He grabs the flaming end of the torch... a lets out a SCREAM! He lunges toward a voluptuous HULA GIRL ICE SCULPTURE,  grabbing the frozen breasts. His burned hands SIZZLE! Ned and Laura don't even notice... gazing only at each ot

dialogues.text: What's he thinking when he looks at  me with that goofy smile...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, does she look stupid in that  hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I told him how I really feel,  he'd probably fire me. What am I  saying? He probably doesn't even  know I exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'll just have to wait. But  he's married. I could wait forever.  Than again... maybe Lana will get  hit by a runaway truck. There's always  a chance that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) But who cares if she... Oh, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright. I was just rambling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, really... you first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh... I just wanted to remind  you about...

dialogues.text: ...the Legal Symposium...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm driving up in the morning.

dialogues.text: A saxophone begins to wail "Lola's Theme." Ned looks up, eyes drawn to the lounge. He sees... Lola... striking a sexy pose on a bar stool, eyes locked Ned. Dizzy walks thru, behind the bar, playing his sax. She grabs a handful of cherries from a glass on the bar,  shoves them in her mouth, cheeks bulging, tongue moving  furiously. A moment later, she pulls out a long chain of  inter-locked cherry stems. Ned reacts, shaken, glancing nervously at Laura. She smil unaware. His eyes flash back to Lola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned's reacts intensely to...

dialogues.text: The eyes of every MALE in the restaurant are riveted on L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching his arm) What is it, Ned? You can tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, reluctant) I'm a man, Laura. And all men feel  passion at one time or another. Even  me.

dialogues.text: (hopeful) Really?

dialogues.text: What would you think of a married  man who gave in to those wild,  sensual, raging desires?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... wow... golly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gulps, eyes wide. The DRUMS pound faster as the Dance in the b.g. pick up the frenetic tempo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if, for just one crazy moment,  he couldn't resist...? He got knocked  for a loop and lost control?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, eager) Gosh... that might be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathless, she breaks a sweat, gasping for air. The DRUM beat LOUDER, FASTER. The b.g. Dancers whip into a frenzy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if a tidal wave of lust crashed  over him and he was sucked into a  vortex of wild, thrashing urges?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of Laura's ballcap beer cans EXPLODE! Beer SPRAYS ou in a huge gush, drenching her! Ned is so preoccupied with his own dilemma, he doesn't even notice. He heaves a sigh pats her hand... smiles philosophically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... it's not your problem. I'll  work it out.

dialogues.text: grasped tightly in Lola's hand. She walks toward Ned and  Laura, a seething rage in her eyes. As she passes the ice sculpture, she stabs the ice pick i the crystalline Hula Dancer's neck! The head breaks off. catches it and keeps coming, tossing the head casually in one hand, like a basketball. Lola appears suddenly at Ned and Laura's table. They look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Laura) Like some ice for your drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops the ice Mermaid head. It shatters Laura's glass bits! Lola turns to Ned with a cold glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your wife know you're...  "working" late? I certainly hope so,  Mr. Ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lights her cigarette with the ice pick lighter, then  flips it like a jackknife. It STICKS into Ned's chair, ri between his legs. Lola flashes a coldly arrogant smile at Laura... then exi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank opens the hood to Ned's car, holding a screwdriver one hand... a wrench in the other. He doesn't know where start.

dialogues.speaker: MAX SHADY'S FEET
dialogues.text: A NEWSBOY tosses a folded newspaper. It lands at Max Shad feet. Max picks up the paper, opens it. The headline says SHADY READS NEWSPAPER IN FRONT OF RAVINE RESIDENCE! Max l around self-consciously, eyes shifting uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana stands by the front door. She calls upstairs to Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up, darling. You'll be late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank slips in, wearing his greasy overalls. He wipes his hands on a rag... giving Lana a sly wink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) It's all taken care of. When do I  knock on the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait until I signal you. When I raise  the blinds... you knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps over to the blinds and demonstrates. He knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, later... right... okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, patronizing. Frank exits. Lana picks up the Sku cuddling him. Ned comes down wearing his trademark gray s Lana kisses him passionately... a final farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive carefully, sweetheart. Say bye- bye to Little Ned. He loves his  daddy... don't you Stink Pot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pets the skunk) See you tonight, Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as Ned closes the door, Lana's smile vanishes and she casually tosses the Skunk aside with a LOUD CRASH O.C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned turns the car key. Nothing. He gets out, opens the ho He stares... dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned comes in, visibly upset. Lana acts surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This neighborhood is getting worse  all the time! Damn kids stole my  engine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you catch the train to  Santa Barbara? It leaves in twenty  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just fly up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned looks at her strangely. She catches herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean... you can't. Armed terrorists  seized the airport this morning. A  plane crashed into the tower... and  all the runways are on fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's fogged in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Dammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my peace of mind... take the  train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana goes to the window, starts to raise the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it. You know how I feel  about riding trains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops... letting the blinds drop down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling... it's only a short trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reconsiders) Yeah... right. A short trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to raise the blinds again. He picks up the pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he hesitates) A short trip to hell in a metal tomb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the receiver down. Lana drops the blinds again..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because both your parents died  in a train wreck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my brother, Jeff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your brother, Morty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My two sisters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My best friend, Al... my dog, Woof...  Grandma Rose... and Uncle Lionel.  All killed by trains!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very convincing) Coincidence, Ned. Beside... that's  the past. They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, resigned) Yeah. I guess I can't bring them  back by not riding on a train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to raise the blinds again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just can't get over this stupid  nagging fear that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She abandons the blinds, leaving them raised part way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear! What about our baby, Ned? I  don't want to raise a child in a  home filled with fear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK at the door. Lana tugs on the cord and th blinds drop with a CRASH. The KNOCKING stops. She pretend it didn't even happen, racing on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you can conquer your fear...  maybe I can conquer my fear of having  a baby with a father who's fearful. (goes for broke) Ned... don't let a train kill our  child before it's even conceived!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heaves a sigh) I guess you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the cord, then hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure now...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. He nods. She quickly pulls the blinds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we'll never make it to the  station. By the time a cab gets  here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOUD KNOCK at the front door. Lana opens it. It's Frank

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the neighborhood. Thought  I'd stop by and pick up my tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank will drive you. Won't you Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I'll take you to the train  station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all freeze. Lana glares at Frank, who is completely  unaware of his faux pas... while Ned tries to figure out that response didn't sound right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb into the van. Ned nervously checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve minutes. We'll never make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA BOOMS DOWN LOW to reveal Max Shady under the v hanging on like a leech, his back only inches from the ro The van drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At an intersection... they see a "DETOUR" sign. Frank and Lana exchange concerned looks. Frank turns the corner. Th van starts vibrating violently, tossing them around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch) We're not going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll make it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shifts gears, guns the engine. They rocket ahead, BOUN WILDLY, their heads THUMPING the car roof! The van SPLASH through deep water, a huge fantail spraying out on both s

They pass a feeble OLD WOMAN struggling to drag a HUGE ST TRUNK along the platform... inches at a time. A REDCAP pa her also, carrying a small overnight case for an attracti elegantly attired SOCIALITE. Everyone ignores the Old Wom Ned looks nervously at the train, already pale.

dialogues.text: Max walks through the car looking for Ned. He pauses, puf on his big cigar. A WOMAN PASSENGER looks up and is shock to see Max's scraped bare butt hanging out only inches aw

dialogues.text: OH! My dear gracious!

dialogues.text: Lana peers over the seat, watching Ned with a cruel smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! I'm Jeff and I'm eight years  old. Didja know if ya put a penny on  the track it'll make the train crash?

dialogues.text: Lana peers over the seat at Ned. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's losing it. You better get up to  the next car. Remember, give me the  high sign as soon as you see the  river. It'll be two minutes and nine  seconds past the tunnel. I'll take  care of the rest. Anything goes  wrong... just make sure you back me  up. (grabs his collar) And don't let him see you.

dialogues.text: Frank gets up, moves down the aisle slowly, eyes on Ned. can't squeeze past the Old Woman, who is still struggling pull her huge trunk down aisle. So... he climbs right ove the top of it... oblivious to her. Frank stares at Ned warily as he gets closer. Suddenly, J squirts a stream of water in Ned's eyes. Frank sees his  chance, rushing past Ned toward the vestibule.

dialogues.text: This... is not a toy!

Without missing a beat, Jeff drops the empty water magazi from the grip and jams a full one in... just like loading cartridge clip. He smirks, ready for action. In the aisle next to them, the Old Woman now pulls her tr back toward the vestibule. Jeff points the squirt gun at  her. Suddenly, she whips around and SQUIRTS HIM in the fa with her own squirt gun! He sputters!

dialogues.text: Max stares out the window, still seething. Behind him, th Old Woman moves into the vestibule, inch by inch, trying drag her trunk into the first coach car. Max turns, sees her struggling and goes to her aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a nice young man. You are so  polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I try to be.

dialogues.text: Jeff is SINGING to Ned... to the tune of "The Old Gray Ma

dialogues.text: Great green gobs of greasy, grimy  gopher guts... mutilated monkey  meat... chopped up dirty birdie's  feet... one pint jar of all-purpose  porpoise pus... cooked in a Mulligan  stew.

dialogues.text: Ned turns queasy. The train lurches. He stiffens.

She pulls out a s of dumbbells, pumps them a couple times... and drops them the floor with a loud CLUNK! Frank watches her from his seat across the aisle with a b expression... only his eyes moving. The Conductor punches the Old Woman's ticket, then holds his hand, waiting. She pulls out a Smith & Wesson .44 Magnum... drops it in his bag. He waits. She pulls out an Uzi.

dialogues.text: Up ahead, we see a tunnel approaching.

dialogues.text: Ned can't take it anymore. He gets up, pale and sweating.

dialogues.speaker: DAY

dialogues.text: Lana sees Ned stumble shakily into the aisle, moving towa the vestibule.

dialogues.text: Lana looks through the small window into the vestibule an catches a glimpse of a gray suit. She ducks back, leaning against the lavatory door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned's dripping face rises up from the sink into view. He  splashes more water on, trying to overcome his queasiness

dialogues.text: Lana reaches into her purse, pulls out a gun. She looks  through the vestibule windows into the first coach car, h eyes searching for Frank.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Frank pokes his head out into the aisle, looking toward L He waves at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana ducks back, pressing herself against the lavatory do gripping the gun, tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned starts to open the door, then stops. He notices the v case. Opens it. A couple of bullets roll around inside. T he sees the blender... puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana leans forward, looking through the vestibule windows watching desperately for Frank's signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks out the window and sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looms ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana sees Frank's frantic signal. She raises the gun, pul the hammer back and steps quickly into...

dialogues.text: Max hears someone enter. He stiffens...
