dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana FIRES!... blowing a hole right through Max and the w behind him! She keeps firing! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLA BLAM! More bullets than the gun could ever possibly hold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned hears the GUNSHOTS and whirls around, looking into th vestibule through the glass window, just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Max turns to face Lana, filled with bloody bullet hole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shootin' at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocked to see it's Max, Lana empties the rest of the bul into him... BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! Max is SLAMMED back i the vestibule door by the impact!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... you're definitely shootin'  at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fires one last shot... BLAM!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max flies out the door, executing a perfect "full gainer  with a triple twist and a half-tuck"... a flawless Olympi style dive... ending with a dead body "belly flop" into t water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sees Max hit the river and lets out a loud "WHOOP!" The Old Woman shoots him a nasty look. He stifles himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned slides the vestibule door open... steps toward Lana. a daze, she raises the gun, points it at him, pulling the trigger... CLICK... CLICK... CLICK. He takes the gun from her gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank jumps up, rushing forward. He skids to a stop... se Ned through the glass! Shocked, he ducks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this crazy world, there's not a  whole lot a guy can count on. But  when the chips are down, I can always  count on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her hand gently and kisses it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You risked your life to save mine. A  guy can't ask any more from a woman  than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then, CLICK! He snaps a handcuff on her wrist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I saw you shoot him, Lana. In  cold blood. I gotta arrest you for  murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned... you wouldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm a cop. I have a job to  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... you said it yourself. I saved  your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, baby. I know a good  lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: SPINNING NEWSPAPER
dialogues.text: whirls at us, snapping to a stop in someone's hands... up down. The hands turn it rightside up. The headline reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paper lowers, revealing Lola Cain with a gratified sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned and Laura move up the steps, surrounded by REPORTERS MEDIA PEOPLE. Questions are being fired from all sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of gun did she use?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a question for the arresting  officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you the arresting officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to ask her attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But aren't you her attorney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only her husband can answer that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will Mrs. Ravine be wearing at  the trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned stops at the top of the stairs, turning to the Report

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lovely powder blue dress with a  cinch waist, full bodice and a  delicately pleated skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it have a matching jacket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it cotton or rayon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perturbed) I said... NO COMMENT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned and Laura turn and enter the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Did she eat any of the victim's body  parts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez... they're really throwing some  tough questions out there today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just doing their job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... well I call it a "high-tech  lynching of an uppity white  housewife."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's huge, dark and shadowy. More than a dozen heavily ar POLICE OFFICERS stand guard all around the perimeter. In center is a cell constructed of iron bars, like an animal cage. Ned and Laura enter. Arch steps over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing the cage) What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only cell available. They had that  serial killer locked up here... you  know, the one who talks his victims  to death then eats them... Hannibal  the Lecturer. But they let him out  for a three week tour to publicize  his new book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch hands him a hardbound book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the cover) "To Serve Man."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cookbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned flips it over.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOOK
dialogues.text: On the back is a picture of HANNIBAL THE LECTURER... wear a baseball catcher's mask with barbed wire over the mouth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And look, look... he autographed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch pulls the front cover of the book open, pointing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads it) To Arch... Love to have you for dinner  sometime... Hannibal. (hands it back) Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch points toward the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're waiting for ya. They didn't  want to start without her attorney  being present.

dialogues.speaker: LANA
dialogues.text: There's a BIG MOTH on her mouth. The CAMERA PULLS BACK SL A beat... she spits the moth off, irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PFFFTT! Damn moths! This place could  use a good exterminator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three POLICE INVESTIGATORS sit opposite Lana at a long ta Moths flutter everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Police Guard) Let's get the SWAT Team in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned, Laura and Arch enter the cage as the Guard exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you get me out of this cage,  Ned? I'm goin' buggy in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge said no bail. Don't worry.  Just tell the truth, you'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the Investigators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's gonna handle the interrogation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your collar... your bust...  your call... your show... your play...  your move... your wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay!... I'll handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura sits at the far end of the table and opens her note Lana pulls out her mirrored compact, starts to apply lips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Mrs. Ravine... there's no makeup  allowed in this building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods toward a warning sign: a circle around a LIPSTICK with a diagonal line thru it. She responds, cool, confide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do... arrest me  for primping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., members of the SWAT Team desperately swat at the fluttering moths. Ned spins his chair around, plants one foot on it, leans his knee, looking hard at Lana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give us a tough time. Just  spill it! What were you doing on  that train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned raises his hand, sits down, leans close, changing his tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidential) As your attorney, I must advise you...  you don't have to answer that  question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned stands, paces, agitated... plants his foot on the cha again. He leans toward her... getting tough again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, quit playing games with us! (fires questions) Who put ya up to it? Where'd you get  the gun? What's your link with the  CIA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned jumps in, motioning with his hands for this to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa whoa whoa! That's it! I  will not tolerate this unwarranted  badgering of my client. She'll have  her day in court, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams his briefcase shut and turns to Lana, sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to thank you, Mrs. Ravine,  for being so cooperative with these  gentlemen. (turns to Laura) Did you get all that down, Laura.  Every word she said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Both of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA MOVES IN to a wire mesh cage at the very back the yard. A small sign on it says: NED JUNIOR. The door i open. The cage is... empty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola rides the roller coaster with Lana's pet Skunk. She  LAUGHS maniacally as they plunge down a steep grade! The Skunk stands stiffly on her lap, his paws planted on guard rail, eyes bulging out!... his fur standing straigh up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned hesitates at the front door. It's open a crack. He mo inside cautiously. There is a strange BUBBLING SOUND comi from the kitchen. He moves toward it... apprehensive. He enters the kitchen and SEES... a huge bubbling pot on stove, foam spilling over from under the lid! His mind re He charges out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned bursts out the back door... CAMERA TRACKING with his  feet as he dashes across the huge back yard... MUSIC POUN He SEES the EMPTY animal cage! The door is open. A fuzzy  blanket hangs halfway out. Shocked, Ned spins around... running back toward the hous CAMERA TRACKING HIS FEET, struggling to keep up. The CAME SLAMS into a tree!... CRACKING the LENS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned bursts in... SEES the bubbling pot!... a huge butcher knife on the counter!... and LOLA, arms outstretched to g him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOOOOooooooo!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whips the cover off the bubbling pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES! Cappelini pomodoro!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts up pasta with a spaghetti spoon... tossing a sp of basil into the pot from the basil-leaf crown she wears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pasta with tomato sauce. Whatsa matta?  You don't like Italian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Ned Junior? WHERE IS HE?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he might like to get out,  so I took him to the amusement park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Lola's arm and drags her toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just break into my house,  cook my food... borrow my skunk! (opens the door) Leave me alone. Stay out of my face!  Out of my neighborhood! Out of my  LIFE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps outside... turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't seen the last of me,  Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SLAMS the door in her face... hesitates a beat, curiou then pulls the door open. Lola's still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned SLAMS the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a media circus! Vendors sell "TRIAL BALLOON" balloon PRESS PHOTOGRAPHERS cluster around a squad of CHEERLEADER wearing sweaters emblazoned with "FREE LANA OR BUST!" acr their chests. They perform a rousing CHEER in front of a sign on the  building that reads... "LE COURTHOUSE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with choreography) Lana, Lana, she's the one Shot a bad  guy with a gun Blew that sucker off  a train Some guys are a friggin'  pain YaaaaaAAAAAAAAY LANA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BBC COMMENTATOR speaks to a TV camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, Americans are making a  mockery of their courts, turning a  murder trial into a media circus!  How can justice ever prevail when it  is ridiculed and reviled in such a  heinously revolting manner? This is  Clement Von Franckenstein returning  you to our BBC studios in London for  the latest photographs of Lady Di  naked in the bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned and Laura push their way through the crush of REPORTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spectators pour through several turnstiles, shoving in th tokens. TV cameras have been set up to broadcast the tria A UNIFORMED THEATER USHER escorts JURY MEMBERS in, checks their tickets, hands them programs and directs them to th seats. Ned and Laura sit at the defense table, next to Lana... w is oblivious to everything, deeply engrossed in a pocket  video game. Ned looks toward the gallery and does a distu take. It's Lola!... sitting in the back row wearing a tailored  suit, large brimmed hat with dark veil... and a SKUNK SKI STOLE draped around her shoulders! Dizzy sits next to her, playing softly on a MUTED SAX.

dialogues.speaker: BROADCAST BOOTH
dialogues.text: A SPORTSCASTER delivers play-by-play of the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a great day for a trial! We  have lots of incandescent lighting,  seventy-two degrees inside... and no  wind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oy vay! Oy vay! Superior Court of  Los Angeles is now in session. And  here he is... direct from a triumphant  one-week engagement in Las Vegas  Circuit Court... the honorable...  the venerable... the totally  irrepressible... Judge Harlan Skan- kyyyyyyy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing "APPLAUSE" signs and flashing "ALL RISE" audienc prompters. Everyone gives the Judge a standing ovation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... has this defense team been  HOT! Thirty-seven straight victories  this year! Let's go down for the  coin toss.

dialogues.speaker: COURTROOM
dialogues.text: The Bailiff flips a coin, motions to the PROSECUTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prosecution wins the flip of the  coin and elects to kick things off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PROSECUTOR delivers her impassioned opening statement

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the prosecution will prove that  this repulsive and degenerate woman  coldly murdered a decent, law-abiding  citizen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumps up) Objection! Move to strike. Hearsay,  irrelevant, stupid, idiotic, caca- doody poo-poo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura is on the stand. Ned hands her a sheet of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And can you tell us what this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's a death threat that Max  Shady FAXED to you on the day he was  released from prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned snatches it back, pacing, folding it into a paper  airplane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FAX in which he threatened to puree  certain parts of my anatomy in a  blender! I'd like to submit this  into evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumps up) Objection! Who cares about the FAX  in this case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll allow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned sails the paper plane toward the COURT CLERK, who is an evidence table already piled high with tagged guns,  appliances, knickknacks, auto parts and other junk. The plane sails toward an open window. The Clerk grabs it going OUT the window with the plane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cheerleaders lead the SPECTATORS in an exuberant CHEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U-G-L-Y! You ain't got no alibi!  You're ugly! Yeah, you're ugly! M-A- M-A! How you think you got that way?  Your Mama! Yeah, your Mama!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., the Court Clerk plummets to the ground, then staggers to his feet, and stumbles... dazed... back towar the courthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the JURORS watches a "DICK VAN DYKE" re-run on a s portable TV monitors, oblivious to the testimony. In the  b.g., the battered Clerk stumbles back in with the paper  plane. The Conductor is on the stand. Ned holds up a BLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is this the blender you found in  the lavatory of the train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like this marked as evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bailiff reaches out, Ned waves him off... instead, to the blender over several heads to the Court Clerk... who  runs to catch it, CRASHING into the wall. The blender fal SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awwwww... a bad call by Ravine. Let's  check out the re-play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the RE-PLAY SCREEN we see the action repeated in SLOW  MOTION as the Sportscaster draws lines, circles, x's and  squiggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at THAT! The Bailiff is wide  open! But instead of handing it off,  Ravine goes for the long bomb. Ohhhh!  The pass is wide! A real wobbler!  There's no way! He scrambles, but he  just can't get his hands on it...  And RIGHT THERE!... (freezes the frame) ...WHAM! That blender is gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the defense table, Laura glances over at Lana, who is  casually browsing through a copy of GALS & GUNS magaz Laura reacts, then, trying to be as diplomatic as possibl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned... did you ever consider that  maybe you don't know women as well  as you think you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now would you tell the court, in  your own words, what you said to Mr.  Ravine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look toward the witness stand. Ned is shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) I'm really worried about this guy.  He could blow our whole case right  out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: WITNESS STAND
dialogues.text: Jeff, the little boy from the train is on the witness sta The Prosecutor stands by, listening as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Great green gobs of greasy grimy  gopher guts... mutilated monkey  meat... itsy-bitsy birdie feet...  Great green gobs of greasy grimy  gopher guts... and me without a spoon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JURORS turn pale and reach for the air sickness bags front of them. The Courtroom erupts. The Judge pounds his gavel LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at Lana) That lady paid me two bucks to sing  it to him...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But NO ONE hears this in all the confusion. The Judge, al looking ill now, bangs his gavel again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recess! Ten minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge, Jury, Attorneys and Spectators are all playing the swings, teeter-totters, monkey bars... having a blast Ned and the Prosecutor play "dodge-ball." Laura cheers Ne on. The Prosecutor rockets the ball at Ned... and just mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha, dork face! Gotcha, gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you didn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! Uh-uh! Missed by a mile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAILIFF steps into CLOSE UP, blowing a whistle loudly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recess is over! Let's go... move it,  move it, move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marching band MUSIC fades off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they go... the UCLA Marching  Band! And now... Holy Toledo!... it  looks like the victim's mother...  Helen Shady... is gonna take the  stand! This will be the first  defensive play of the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Shady is on the stand. Ned paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Shady... would you tell us about  your son, Max. Was he a... a good  boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the best. And that's not just  a mother talking. You can ask anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he got into trouble once in  awhile... like all kids do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know, pranks. Little jokes  and things. But he was so cute. I  have pictures!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches down into her huge purse, pulling out a photo album. She opens it, showing Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. This is when he set the cat on  fire... (then, assuring him) Oh... but the cat deserved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks, points) And what, uh... what are these...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshmallows. He just loved to toast  marshmallows over a roaring cat.  Burned on the outside... all soft in  the middle. (turns page) And right here... this was taken on  the day he left the priesthood to  join the Green Berets.

dialogues.speaker: THE JURY
dialogues.text: They rise slowly out of their seats, craning their necks, trying to see the photos.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Ned is now seated next to Mrs. Shady in the witness box,  looking at the photo album with her. Judge Skanky peers o the side of the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, delighted) Oh yes! That was during his Ku Klux  Klan phase. He would take the sheets  right off my bed... cut those little  holes in them. What a stitch he was!

dialogues.speaker: THE SPECTATORS
dialogues.text: are now on their feet, all straining to catch a glimpse o the photos in the album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is this Max... with all the  tools... fixing his bike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snatches the photo out of the album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why that shouldn't even be in there!  It's his rotten little half-brother. (rips up photo) Stinkin' little pecker... he never  was any good...

dialogues.speaker: BROADCAST BOOTH
dialogues.text: The Sportscaster is pushing his face against the broadcas booth glass, trying to see what everyone's looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at another) Oh! I didn't like these neo-Nazi  boys. They were all so fussy and  persnickety about everything. Heil  this and heil that. (flips the page) Oh look... here's Max with his  chainsaw. He loved to go to the  national park and cut down those  giant old trees. It made him feel so  patriotic. You know, if he hadn't  been such a successful criminal... I  think he would have been a lumberjack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Court Clerk, Bailiff and Court Recorder have all move around behind the witness stand, peering over Mrs. Shady' shoulder at the photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearful, angry) But now he'll never be anything! Not  since... (stands up, points) ...that woman, your wife, pulled the  trigger and put my little Max in his  grave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Shady! Do not POINT your finger  in my courtroom. It's discourteous,  impolite and disrespectful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you tell me what to do with my  finger! It's been more places than  you've ever dreamed of!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bangs gavel) Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll point my finger wherever I want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Shady goes berserk... leaping from the witness stand pointing several different fingers at Judge Skanky. The Bailiff attempts to restrain her, but she breaks free scurrying around the courtroom, pointing fingers at every CHAOS prevails!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Irritable Man from the train is on the stand... Max's huge cigar stuck in his ear! The hair around his ear is  scorched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you encounter the victim... Max  Shady... on board the train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And I told him... "this is the  NO SMOKING car! Would you please put  out your damn cigar!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is that the cigar in your ear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man strains to see the cigar out of the corner of his eye. Impatient, Ned finally holds up a small pocket mirro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like the cigar and the head of  this witness entered into evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bailiff picks up the Irritable Man and dumps him on t evidence table, where he is tagged by the Court Clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defense calls... Lana Ravine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana is on the stand. The Bailiff swears her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you swear to tell the truth, the  whole truth and nothing but the truth  so help you God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks to Judge) Do I have to answer that, Harlan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no dear. I'll vouch for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Mrs. Ravine... may I call you  Lana?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Call me Angel Tits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I object!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained. Counselor... you will  address Angel Tits as Mrs. Ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Mrs. Ravine... would you please tell  the court... what were you doing on  that train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Max Shady at the station...  saw him get on board. I knew he'd  made threats to kill you and mutilate  your reproductive organs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned and EVERY MALE in the courtroom winces at this, doubl over in imagined agony. Lana pauses, then continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so I got on the train too... so I  could warn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to have children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday. With the right man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you couldn't have children if  my... (makes a gesture) ...were... (another gesture) ...and, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you followed him, knowing you had  to protect me... your husband...  your best friend... the man you  love... the future father of your  children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you saw that maniac standing  in the vestibule, waiting to pulverize  my pee-pee... you pulled the gun and  fired and fired and FIRED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And fired and fired and fired and  fired and fired and fired and fired...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses to count off on her fingers, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and fired and fired and fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defense rests, your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COURTROOM ARTIST has been sketching intensely through the trial. We finally see... he's been sketching a BOWL O FRUIT on the Court Recorder's desk. Ned picks up some fru from the bowl and approaches the defense table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you convict a courageous  woman who risked everything to save  the life of her beloved husband? A  woman who acted boldly to stop a  demented maniac from doing THIS!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned shoves the BANANA and two PLUMS into a demonstration  blender on the defense table. He hits the puree button an the blender WHIRRS loudly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts over) ...pulverizing the private parts of  the man she loves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All MALES in the courtroom react with pained expressions, cringing and doubling-over. Ned turns the blender off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (directly to Jury) Lana Ravine is a loving wife and the  potential mother of my potential  child. I challenge YOU to strike a  blow for motherhood and the American  justice system! Put the "con" back  in the Constitution. Put the "ju"  back in jurisprudence. Put the "can"  back in American. And put the "dom"  back in freedom. Find this woman  INNOCENT!... so we can all go to bed  happy tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPORTER opens the door marked PRESS ROOM. Inside, a DO REPORTERS press their pants on a dozen ironing boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jury's back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reporters scramble for the door, pulling their pants

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA FOLLOWS a folded piece of paper as the Jurors  pass it along to the FOREMAN... who hands it to the Baili who hands it to the Judge. He unfolds it, reads it... the winks flirtatiously at the FEMALE JUROR who wrote it. She blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to business) So... has the jury reached a verdict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands up) Yes we have, your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you find the defendant... on  the count of manslaughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the count of murder in the first  degree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Count of Monte Cristo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOISTEROUS CLAMOR in the court. The electronic signs FL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Then on the count of three,  let's all get the hell out of here!  One... two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jury and Spectators start to rise. The Judge hesitate gavel poised, shooting them a warning look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... for... it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone FREEZES halfway out of their seats... waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and a half... THREE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smacks his gavel. Everyone scatters for the doors, but Judge Skanky beats them out of the room. Lana turns cool, dropping her courtroom facade. She pluck off her earrings, unbuttons the neck of her dress, reache in and magically pulls out her bra, tossing it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, counselor, looks like you won  another case. Lucky for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO LEGAL AIDES sneak up behind Ned and dump a big plasti barrel of Gatorade cans over his head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over P. A. system) Attention courtroom shoppers! All  trial evidence now on sale. Forty to  sixty percent off all exhibits!  Everything must go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to SEE: Spectators and Jurors browse through th clutter of junk in front of the Court Clerk on the eviden table. An IRRITABLE WOMAN claims the Irritable Man, grabb the cigar from his ear and throwing it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, Bernard... smoking cigars  is bad for your hearing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him away as Lana steps up, with a cigarette dan from her lips. Lana picks up her gun and spins the cylind It's loaded. The battered Court Clerk limps over, smiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ravine! What can I do for ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much for my gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura sees this... turns to Ned with a look of shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it! She just bought  her gun back! The gun she used to  kill a man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned looks off toward Lana with admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... the same gun that saved my  life. I'm sure it has sentimental  value.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lana wades into the crowd of REPORTERS, some still wit pants, the CAMERA MOVES TO Lola, who is watching Lana fro the back of the courtroom. Lola pulls a small cord hanging from the side of her hat. opening her veil like window drapes. She's not happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lays on a mechanic's "creeper", working under a car Lana steps between his feet. He hears her and rolls out, crotch sliding to a stop against her legs. He looks up,  covered with black grease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... you did it. Ya beat the rap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets to his feet, cocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... I knew he'd spring ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks toward him, her voice cold, accusing. He backs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't lift a finger, Frank. You  let me take all the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heeeee-eeey... what could I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana pulls the gun from her purse, pointing it at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were gonna let me rot in the  slammer... never say a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... you're out... free. Now we're  together. That's what counts. We can  try again! Forget triple indemnity.  We'll whack him and split three mil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not splitting anything, Frank. (cocks the gun) And you know too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arrogant) Come on, Lana. You're not gonna shoot  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brashly turns his back to her, putting some tools away She sees a huge electric powered SCREWDRIVER on the workb next to her, smiling diabolically. She lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. (then, seductive) Maybe I'll just screw you to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs arrogantly... starts to unbutton his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're talkin' baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Lana's SILHOUETTE on the window as she raises the power screwdriver and turns it on. WHIRR-R-R-R-R-R-R-R-R- The CAMERA WHIPS AROUND and PUSHES IN TO...

dialogues.speaker: LOLA
dialogues.text: watching the murder from her car. There is a... FLASH! Th another! And another! We are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE PHOTOGRAPHER takes FLASH pictures of the crime s The CORONER, COPS, FORENSIC MEN... all do their thing. Ne and Arch amble in, looking around. Arch is eating Nachos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your step, guys. There's a lot  of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throughout this scene, in the b.g., the milling COPS and  INVESTIGATORS slip on all the blood, as if on slick ice, fall out of frame, their arms and legs flailing helplessl One of the Coroner's INVESTIGATORS approaches Arch and Ne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a suicide. We found a  note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a rolled piece of paper with a pair of tweeze Ned takes it, trying to unroll it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was stuck up his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned hands it off to Arch, who casually unrolls it. The  Investigator slips, arms waving, and falls out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading it) "I can't take it anymore. I'm a  mediocre mechanic... and a lousy  lover."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sure got that right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arch gives Ned a very strange look. Ned feels his stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "mechanic" part, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., various COPS pair up to have their pictures  taken by the Police Crime Scene Photographer... posing,  grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at the body) I don't know why, Arch, but I just  can't shake this crazy hunch it wasn't  suicide.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA MOVES
dialogues.text: behind Ned on his line, revealing Frank... pinned to the  wall by the power screwdriver stuck in his back! It's sti running... vibrating with a GRINDING HUM. Ned reaches out and turns the screwdriver OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned enters, pausing. He hears VOICES. He goes to the livi room. Lana and Lola turn to see him in the doorway. He is shocked. Lana looks shaken. But Lola is cool... in contro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... uh, Ned... This is Lola, um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous, defensive) Um? She told you her name was Um?  And what other lies did she tell  you? I've never seen this woman in  my life! Never followed her home!  Never had sex with her in the  refrigerator! It's all a sick  fantasy... and I deny everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Lola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will women like you learn, you  can't tear apart a perfectly good  marriage with your vicious lies...  Miss UMMMM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually... it's Smith. Lola Smith.  I sell vacuum cleaners, Mr. Ravine.  The big powerful kind that suck up  everything in sight. I was just  telling your wife, if she wants to  get rid of all her dirt, she has to  be willing to pay the price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Lana with a cold and contemptuous glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know what you decide, Mrs.  Ravine. I'm sure we can work out a  convenient "payment" plan. A pleasure  meeting you... Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola exits. As soon as the door closes, Lana whirls aroun in a fury!... SMASHING a lamp! She SHRIEKS furiously!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... hate... SALESMEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arms around her, comforting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's been a tough ordeal...  with the trial and everything. Tell  you what... let's take a trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just the two of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (darkly inspired) I like that. Just you and me... all  alone. I'll start packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Listen... I got something to  take care of. I'll be back in awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her and exits. Lana turns to look up toward the landing, a vengefully insane smile clouding her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A demanding KNOCK at the door. Lola hesitates at the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door CRASHES OPEN! Ned is silhouetted in the doorway. looks really pissed! Lola turns and runs. Ned sprints aft her, leaping through the air... bringing her down with a  tackle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her foot shoots out, smashing him right in the face... WH She jumps up and scrambles away. Ned pursues her. She gra a bottle of scotch from the counter, spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws the bottle! He ducks and it shatters on the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. I'm driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whirls on one foot, nailing him in the head with a FL SPIN KICK! He stumbles back, dazed. She grabs an ice pick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's get to the point!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola charges! Ned rolls onto his back, jamming both feet  into her stomach, heaving her up over him... thru the air She SLAMS into the wall!... then slowly turns... still co and collected. She raises a cigarette... lights it with t ice pick "lighter."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your problem, tough guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from my life, my wife, my  home and my pets! I'm taking Lana on  a vacation and when I come back, I  don't ever want to see your face  again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves her against the wall... the cigarette flying aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) A VACATION! She doesn't deserve a  VACATION! She's a brat! A bad girl!  She always was and always will be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her by the shoulders, shaking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You don't  know anything about Lana?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know EVERYTHING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her hard) How do you know her? Who is she to  you? TELL ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clams up. He slaps her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is she!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's your wife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps her again!) Who is she!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps her again) Liar! Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's your wife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his hand to slap her hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHO IS SHE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SLAPS him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues to slap him... back and forth... repeating answers... "She's your wife"... "She's my sister!"... "Yo wife!"... "My sister!"... "Wife!"... "Sister!" He reaches a boiling point, raising two fingers, preparin to give her the Three Stooges "two-fingered eye poke." Sh blocks it with her hand and shoves him away. Then, she  executes a perfect Three Stooges "wiggly-hand head slap", telling him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's your wife... AND my sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned is stunned. MUSIC THUNDERS dramatically! Lana clicks stereo off. The MUSIC STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was spoiled rotten! She stole  everything I ever had. Everything!  Including him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him? Who, him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne. The boy's gym teacher. He  was older. So mature... so strong.  He smelled like dirty sweat socks  and old basketballs. And he was all  mine. For awhile. (turning bitter) But Lana wasn't satisfied with her  own things. She had to have mine  too. She took it all... my makeup,  my sweaters, my shoes, my underwear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wore the same clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were identical twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? You two  don't look anything alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore. One day I caught her  stealing my lavender eye shadow and  she smashed my face in with a shovel.  I had fifty-three operations. When  the doctors were finished with me...  I looked like THIS! I'm ugly. UGLY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did a terrific job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look in the mirror. I can SEE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... you're gorgeous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell that to Dwayne. When he saw my  face, he left me for HER... because  she looked more like me than I did!  First she stole my looks... then she  stole the only man who ever loved  me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes toward him... feeling in control once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I found a way to get even. The  best revenge possible. Destroy her  marriage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you did all this? Seduced  me... harrassed me... the tape...  the flowers... the phone calls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been hangin' out with Dick Tracy,  haven't ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't work. Lana loves me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. I'm blackmailing  her for everything she's worth. She  murdered that greasy auto mechanic.  I saw her do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Lana killed Frank Kelbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also stunned) Kelbo! His name was Kelbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why? Did he burn you on car  repairs too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwayne's name was Kelbo. He had a  son. Frankie Kelbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned wanders to his car, climbs in, sits there... stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pieces of the puzzle were falling  into place and I didn't like the  picture they were making. If Lana  really killed Frank Kelbo, then I  had misjudged her by a mile. Sure...  he was a lousy mechanic. But murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned rubs his temples, shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was all starting to give me a  headache bigger than the national  deficit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" plays on the stereo. Lola sits on th floor by an end table, eyes dazed, staring blankly. A lam with a "clapper" switch sits on the table. As the CAMERA MOVES IN SLOWLY to her, she absently "claps the light off... then on... then off... then on... then o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON female hands using a keyhole saw to cut through railing on the second floor landing above the foyer. Outside... the SOUND of a car... headlights! The sawing s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned pulls up. The house is dark and ominous. So is the MU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door is open a crack. He cautiously pushes it a the door CR-E-A-K-S open very slowly. The door STOPS, but the LOUD CREAKING continues. Ned touches it lightly with tip of his finger. The CREAKING STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned moves up the stairs. The CAMERA BOOMS UP with him, HO ON an ECU of the partially severed railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned enters. Hot water gushes from the faucet into a clawf bathtub. He turns the water off, looking around, puzzled. Loosens his tie, rubs his head. A splitting headache. Ope the medicine cabinet and... SCREECH! YEOW! CRASH! A CAT l out!... darts away. There's a NOISE from downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is POUNDING on the door. Ned enters and opens it. It's Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned! I'm glad you're here. I have so  much to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in. I'll make some tea. Grab  a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... I brought my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drags a chair in behind her, sits at the kitchen tabl Ned puts a kettle on the burner, turns it on. He starts  searching through the cupboard for teabags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lottery ticket and a laundry  receipt. (lays them on table) I found them in the pocket of that  suit you wore the night you were  working under cover with a client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned freezes, staring out the window, unable to face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember that night, don't ya  Ned? Then it hit me. Lottery starts  with L-O. Laundry starts with L-A. L- O... L-A. Lola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned turns to her when he hears Lola's name... looking baf by this convoluted piece of logic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs it off) Don't sweat it. It's the way a woman's  mind works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the cupboard, picking up a container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Ovaltine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Then I remembered you told me  some guy named Frank had been working  on your wife's car for two months.  You with me so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm way ahead of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings the Ovaltine container to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well back it up. You probably took a  wrong turn. Remember your insurance  policy... the one we couldn't find?  I started thinking, who else had  access to it beside you and me? The  answer came up... Lana. And since  she's a woman, it's probably hidden  right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge ceramic cookie jar sits on the table in front of t Laura SMASHES it with her fist, breaking it open! Cookies spill out... and the insurance policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's where she hid the Oreos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down... starts eating Oreos... twisting them apar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned, Lana wasn't trying to save your  life when she shot Max Shady. She  and Frank were plotting to kill you  and collect on your insurance policy.  But she shot the wrong guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the craziest thing I ever  heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she presses on) Don't you see... Frank was going to  let her take the fall. So she murdered  him and tried to make it look like  suicide. (beat) That's when I realized there was a  connection between Lola and Lana...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... they're sisters. Twin sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hang on to your jock strap,  Ned. There's more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unrolls a complex genealogical chart... walks him thr it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only is Frank's father Dwayne  Kelbo, notoriously amorous gym teacher  and Lola Cain's former lover...  Frank's mother is Helen Shady. Max  and Frank are half-brothers who never  met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura pauses dramatically, then announces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your lovely wife, Lana, murdered  both of Helen Shady's sons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you haven't even heard my story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The keyhole saw cuts through the railing. The CAMERA REVE Lana, eyes filled with Machiavellian rage. She enters the bathroom, lays the saw blade down. Suddenl a PAIR OF HANDS plunge into frame, grabbing her by the th We GO WITH HER as she is pushed back into the tub, the ha forcing her head under water. Lana grabs a diving mask, c it over her face. One of the attacking hands rips it away Lana grabs a snorkel, sticking it in her mouth. The hand  pulls it from her, tossing it aside. The hand shoves a little RUBBER DUCKIE into Lana's mouth! Lana struggles, finally going limp. Her open eyes stare u from beneath the water. The last few bubbles rise to the  surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turned into a monster. And that's  when I left him. I just couldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tea kettle WHISTLES! Laura pulls it off the burner. T whistling subsides... replaced by the distant SOUND of wa running upstairs. Ned cocks his head, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That damn faucet keeps turning on  all by itself. I'll go check it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll make the Ovaltine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned exits. Laura opens the Ovaltine container. It's empty DARK SHADOW moves past the window behind Laura. Suspense  MUSIC. Laura opens the cupboard. PIGEONS explode out, win beating furiously! She catches her breath, looks in the  cupboard. The cans and boxes are covered with pigeon shit She shoves them aside, looking for the Ovaltine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned looks up toward the light from the bathroom. Water se over the edge of the landing and down the steps. As he mo up the steps, the SOUND of MUSIC... the familiar strains "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida"... grows louder and LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's filled with steam. He waves the steam away... STARTL to see Lana's lifeless body beneath the water, the rubber duckie jammed into her mouth. The tub overflows on the fl He turns the faucet off. The water stops... and so does t MUSIC. Puzzled, he turns the faucet on. The MUSIC STARTS. Turns it off. The MUSIC STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Laura turns away to enter the pantry... her Husband's  twisted face suddenly appears in the kitchen window!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned enters. The MUSIC is coming from the closet. Ned yank the door open! A flock of PIGEONS bursts out!... revealin GUEST MUSICIAN playing an instrument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sittin' in for Dizzy. He had a  gig tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned shuts the door, eyes shifting. Lola must be near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura searches the large walk-in pantry for tea bags. She hears a LOUD CRASH of BREAKING GLASS in the kitchen... st and listens... then casually shrugs it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's Husband stands in the kitchen. The back door is  open... the window shattered. He SEES... the kitchen towe hanging sloppily on the rack! The disorganized clutter of cans and boxes in the cupboard! WE PUSH IN to his wildly  insane eyes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ned enters the upstairs landing, we hear VOICES in his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women are an open book. You can always  tell the rotten apples from the  peaches. I'd stake my career on it...  stake my career on it... stake my  career on it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The repetitive ECHO gets to him. He smacks his head with palm of his hand. The skipping stops... followed by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...If anyone ever proves me wrong,  I'll throw away my badge.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DARKNESS
dialogues.text: A woman's HAND unrolls a leather kit... the "U-Pick an Ic Pick Porta-Pik-Pak!"... with seven ice picks in separate  slots, each labeled with a day of the week. The hand selects "Wednesday's" ice pick, pulls it out. Th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It CHIMES loudly. It's twelve midnight!

dialogues.speaker: THE HAND
dialogues.text: returns the ice pick to its slot, selects the one for  Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura comes out of the pantry. She stops... gasps! Everyt in the cupboard is neatly stacked! All the towels are  straight! She whirls around... coming face to face with her Husband He smiles demonically, holding up the Ninja Turtle float  ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget something, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned nears the bathroom door and suddenly... A PIERCING SC Lola charges, an ice pick raised over her head! She knock him backward, into the bathroom, slashing at him. But he  deflects the attack, grabbing at her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura backs away from her Husband. He holds her wedding r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot to flush, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ned and Lola continue their violent struggle... Lola g toiletries to aid in her attack. She squirts Ned with SHA CREAM... squeezes TOOTHPASTE in his hair... and throws BA POWDER in his face! Ned is blinded. Gaining the advantage, Lola shoves him ba slamming his head into the wall. He's dazed, helpless. Lola raises the ice pick, moving forward to strike! But N grabs a HAIR BLOWER and swings it around, pointing it at like a gun! She freezes... then smiles contemptuously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do, Ned? Blow me  away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She LAUGHS arrogantly. Ned clicks on the hair blower to H a blast of HOT AIR hitting Lola's face, puffing her cheek out, pushing her back, hair flying wildly! Her backside hits the railing where Lana has cut it... th wood splintering! Lola tumbles over backward, SCREAMING! She hangs suspende in mid-air for a moment, like a cartoon character, arms  flailing. Then... WHOOM!... she FALLS to the marble floor below, hitting with a LOUD THUD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's Husband hears Lola fall, turning. Laura grabs the iron skillet and CLOBBERS him with it! BONG! He goes down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never forget anything... honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned stares at the hair blower in his hand. Filled with di and revulsion, he throws the "weapon" down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura pulls TWO REVOLVERS from her purse... spinning them like John Wayne... expertly tossing one over her back,  catching it in front! She heads for the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura pauses, looks down at Lola's body... notices someth She pushes Lola's skirt a bit higher with the toe of her  shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged) Those are MY panties!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up... sees a light emanating from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LANDING
dialogues.text: Laura moves through the shadows... stops outside the bath pressing her back against the wall, guns up and ready. She swivels into the doorway... taking a shooter's stance guns pointed! She sees... LANA... submerged in the tub, f up, the rubber duckie in her mouth. Laura steps back and turns... right into a THING covered white! Startled, she SHRIEKS! Ned drops the white towel h using to wipe off all of the shaving cream and toothpaste Relieved to see it's Ned, she throws her arms around him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Ned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right... there's a million  things I don't know about women.  Maybe you can teach me a few hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out his police badge, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell... I had too many careers anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses it away, over the railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The badge drops from above, landing on the floor right in front of Lola's lifeless face. A beat. Her eyes pop open!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the rubber duckie pops to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LANDING
dialogues.text: Laura hugs Ned again, arms locked around his neck, still  gripping a gun in each hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Ned, I love you. I always loved  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola sits bolt upright, bloody but still bouncy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana suddenly SITS UP in the tub, inhaling a huge GASP of air, her eyes wild!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's Husband's eyes POP OPEN! He SITS UP suddenly...  smashing his head into the sharp corner of the kitchen ta He topples back slowly... really dead! Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lola's feet move steadily up each stair... her bloody han grasping the ice pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lana's feet step out of the tub, water dripping all aroun She picks up the pointed saw from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LANDING
dialogues.text: Ned and Laura still embrace, her forearms crisscrossed be his neck. It's been a long embrace. Suddenly, Lana and Lola both appear, SCREAMING like bansh Lana charges from the bathroom, grasping the sharp saw bl Lola races at them from the stairway... with the ice pick Without missing a beat, Laura raises the barrels of both  guns and FIRES at them simultaneously... right next to Ne ears. The impact of one bullet knocks Lana all the way back thr the bathroom, CRASHING spectacularly out the window! The  other bullet sends Lola flipping down the staircase! Ned looks stunned, his eyes crossed... the thundering gun still ringing in his ears. Laura proudly blows the gunsmo away from the end of each barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deafened) WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said... I GOT 'EM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUH?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells) THEY'RE DEAD! GONE! KA-PUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strains to make out what she's saying, ears still ring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells back) SURE I'LL MARRY YOU! NEXT TUESDAY  WOULD BE PERFECT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Laura opens her mouth to correct him, then decide against it. She smiles... speaking softly, almost shyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But I want to have kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears THIS... smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR DAWN
dialogues.text: We MOVE IN SLOWLY toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... maybe I was wrong. Maybe women  really are like a big jigsaw puzzle...  with pieces that never seem to fit  where you want 'em to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned and Laura are in bed, wrapped in each other's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is, there are three things  that men can't possibly ever do...

dialogues.speaker: NED AND LAURA
dialogues.text: Revealing that it's NOT "voice over narration." Ned is  actually rattling on aloud again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...understand women... give birth...  and program a VCR. And giving birth  is the easy one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Laura?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock off the chatter, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at her. They kiss. Romantic SAXAPHONE MUSIC beg to play... only this time, it's "Laura's Theme." The CAMERA PULLS BACK SLOWLY... revealing Dizzy laying on the bed beside them... playing the sax. After a beat, Laura turns to Dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't need you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned casually slips him a twenty dollar bill. Dizzy slips the bed and out the door. Laura turns to Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can make our own music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hand reaches slowly over the edge of the bed, toward floor. Suddenly... she comes up with a CONCERTINA, a smal accordian... and begins to play it! Ned lays there listening for a few moments, a stunned loo frozen on his face. Then... he reaches under the pillow a pulls out a HARMONICA and joins in. The CAMERA BOOMS UP to a HIGH ANGLE SHOT... as they play  MEDLEY of all the MUSIC heard in the film.

dialogues.speaker: ROLL END CREDITS
dialogues.text: After the final credit, WE HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned, do you know... I want you to  make love to me all night long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But if you hum a few bars...  I'll fake it.
